ExplntnTxt: Scholarship recipients are selected based on established merit and need-based criteria. The Financial Aid Director and Academic Department Heads work together to select institutional scholarship recipients. Qualifications for scholarships vary. All scholarships are monitored by the Financial Aid Department.
SCHOLARSHIPS AND TUITION WAIVERS FOR STUDENTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' SUMMIT CHRISTIAN COLLEGE ACCOUNTS AND APPLIED TO TUITION, FEES, ROOM AND BOARD.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIPS AND AWARDS ARE PLACED DIRECTLY INTO EACH STUDENT'S ACCOUNT WITH THE COLLEGE. THE SCHOLARSHIPS AND AWARDS ARE USED TO PAY THE COST OF TUITION AND FEES OF THE COLLEGE.

THE COLLEGE PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS ENROLLED IN ITS PROGRAMS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON STUDENT ACHIEVEMENTS IN ACADEMICS, PERFORMING ARTS, AND ATHLETICS. TO BE CONSIDERED FOR SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE, STUDENTS MUST APPLY FOR ADMISSION, SUBMIT ACADEMIC TRANSCIPTS OF PRIOR EDUCATIONAL WORK, SUBMIT TEST SCORES (ACT/SAT), AND SUBMIT AN APPLICATION FOR THE SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM. SOME SCHOLARSHIPS REQUIRE ADDITIONAL RECOMMENDATIONS OR CERTIFICATIONS BY THIRD PARTIES. ACADEMIC PROGRESS OF SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS IS MONITERED, AND THEY MUST EARN A MINIMUM AMOUNT OF COLLEGE CREDITS AND A MINIMUM GPA EACH SEMESTER IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN ELIGIBILITY.

GRANT FUNDS ARE ADMINISTERED IN COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL AND STATE APPLICABLE REGULATIONS. GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED ACCORDING TO ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA INCLUDING SCHOLASTIC ABILITY, CHRISTIAN INVOLVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND/OR TALENT. GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ACCOUNTED FOR IN SEPARATE GENERAL LEDGER ACCOUNTS WHICH ARE RECONCILED INTERNALLY. GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AUDITED ANNUALLY IN COMPLIANCE WITH OMB CIRCULAR A-133.

GARDNER-WEBB UNIVERSITY PRACTICES A YEARLY REVIEW (AT THE END OF THE SPRING SEMESTER) TO MONITOR ALL STUDENTS AWARDED AN INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIP BASED ON THE FOLLOWING CRITERIA: 1) ENROLLMENT STATUS 2) HOUSING STATUS 3) GPA 4) MAINTAINING SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE UNIVERSITY'S POLICY.

MOST GRANTS AND SCHOLARHSIPS ADMINISTERED BY BELLIN COLLEGE ARE AWARDED BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED; SOME HAVE ADDITIONAL ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS SET BY DONORS OR OTHER ENTITIES. THE BURSAR AND DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID RECONCILE AWARDS/PAYMENTS ON A REGULAR BASIS TO ENSURE ACCURACY ON STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS.
The college has policies and procedures to determine eligibility for student financial assistance. They also comply with the Federal requirements for awarding student aid.
ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED FOR APPROPRIATE USE BY MONITORING REGISTRATION AND SATISFACTORY COMPLETION OF COURSES AND PROGRAMS TOWARDS EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS.

AUGSBURG COLLEGE OFFERS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS TO HELP REDUCE THEIR OUT-OF-POCKET TUITION COSTS. STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE OF THIS FORM MUST MEET SPECIFIC CRITERIA SUCH AS ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS WHETHER PUT IN PLACE BY THE COLLEGE OR BY DONORS OF RESTRICTED FUNDS.

AN INDEPENDENT SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE REVIEWS ALL APPLICANTS AND AWARDS THE SCHOLARSHIP AMOUNTS. ALL APPLICATIONS FOR FINANCIAL AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE REVIEWED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. STUDENTS WHO ARE QUALIFIED FOR SCHOLARSHIPS ARE REVIEWED BY THE INDEPENDENT SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE FOR RECOMMENDATION, FINAL RECOMMENDATIONS ARE THEN REFERRED TO THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE FOR AWARDING.

KFF OPERATES SOLELY FOR THE BENEFIT OF KCC. ALL GRANT EXPENDITURES ARE MADE BASED ON RECOMMENDATIONS/REQUESTS FROM THE COLLEGE. EACH GRANT WILL ACCOMPLISH THE EDUCATIONAL GOALS AND PURPOSES OF THE COLLEGE. THE ORGANIZATION MONITORS PROPER USE OF THE FUNDS BY MAINTAINING CONTINUAL CONTACT WITH RECIPIENT ORGANIZATIONS.

SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID ARE AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF NEED AND MERIT. FUNDS ARE APPLIED TO INDIVIDUAL ACCOUNTS, AND RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE UNIVERSITY'S DOCUMENT RETENTION AND DESTRUCTION POLICY.

All scholarships are awarded based upon specific criteria maintained by the financial aid office. Requirements for receiving scholarships depend upon other factors, such as grade point average, family income or economic need. The Colleges finanical aid staff monitors the eligibility guidelines to ensure compliance. The College also undergoes the required OMB A-133 audit annually.
ALL FINANCIAL AID THAT IS AWARDED IS CREDITED TO THE TUITION BILLING FOR THE STUDENT. ALL AID IS USED TO REDUCE THE TUITION PAYABLE.

In 2013, Wongu University offered the "Founder's Class Scholarship" to all incoming students. After the student's first quarter the Scholarship is continued based on specified performance standards including a minimum cumulative GPA. All students are informed of these standards, and also informed that the scholarship program will be continued until such time as the University attains ACAOM Candidacy status.

The use of funds is managed by the Foundation of CSU Monterey Bay. SCHEDULE I, PART IV SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION THE CONGRESSIONAL SCHOLARSHIP AND THE LEADERSHIP PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS ARE TRACKED THROUGH ANNUAL REGISTRATION.

THE COLLEGE DOES NOT GIVE ANY NON-CASH SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED TO STUDENTS THROUGH CREDITING THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS. IF THE STUDENT HAS ANY EXCESS SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS OVER THEIR CHARGES, THESE FUNDS ARE DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK. THE COLLEGE'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S. ARE AS FOLLOWS: THE COLLEGE HAS APPOINTED DIRECTORS, WHO REPORT TO THE APPROPRIATE VICE PRESIDENTS, OVER ALL FEDERAL GRANT PROGRAMS. THESE DIRECTORS ARE CHARGED WITH PERFORMING ALL GRANT-RELATED ACTIVITIES INCLUDING APPLICATION, MONITORING OF EXPENDITURES AND REPORTING, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF DRAW-DOWNS OF FEDERAL FUNDS. DRAW-DOWNS ARE PERFORMED BY THE COLLEGE'S CONTROLLER AFTER REQUESTS ARE MADE BY THE DIRECTOR TO THE CONTROLLER. THE CONTROLLER REVIEWS THE REQUESTS FOR DRAW-DOWNS, WHICH INCLUDE DOCUMENTATION OF ALL DIRECT AND INDIRECT PROGRAM EXPENSES, BEFORE MAKING THE DRAW-DOWNS. A SINGLE AUDIT IS PERFORMED ANNUALLY BY THE COLLEGE'S INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.
Students receiving scholarships are evaluated by the College's assessment of academic achievement, financial need and other similar standards.

GRANT FUNDS ARE ONLY AWARDED TO THOSE STUDENTS WHO MEET THE REQUIREMENTS FOR A PARTICULAR GRANT OR GRANTS. ALSO, THEY MUST MEET OUR SATISFACTORY PROGRESS POLICY TO CONTINUE RECEIVING THESE FUNDS, WHETHER IT IS FEDERAL GOVERNMENT OR FAULKNER UNIVERSITY FUNDS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Scholarships are provided to students based on specific criteria established by student financial services in regards to eligibility, student selection and requirements of the scholarship. Each scholarship recipient will be monitored by the University to confirm that they have satisfied all scholarship requirements. The actual scholarships are credited to the students tuition bills. No scholarships are awarded directly to the student.

STUDENTS ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE A FAFSA. ELIGIBILITY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS IS DETERMINED BY THE APPLICABLE FEDERAL AND STATE GUIDELINES, BY THEIR ACADEMIC CREDENTIALS, AND FINANCIAL NEED. STUDENTS ARE APPROPRIATELY AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND THE AWARDS ARE TRANSFERRED TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS IN THE BUSINESS OFFICE. ALL SCHOLARSHIP AND GRANT FUNDS ARE RECONCILED EACH SEMESTER AND REPORTED TO THE APPROPRIATE AUTHORITIES OR AGENCIES. FUNDS ARE ALSO AUDITED ANNUALLY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE GRANTS (SCHOLARSHIPS) MADE BY THE UNIVERSITY ARE A REDUCTION OF THE TUITION AND FEES PAID BY THE STUDENT TO THE SCHOOL. GRANT FUNDS ARE NOT SENT TO OUTSIDE ENTITIES.

THE UNIVERSITY PAYS GRANTS/ASSISTANCE IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS. ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON CRITERIA STIPULATED BY THE DONOR. INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED ON FINANCIAL NEED, ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, SERVICE AND FAMILY SITUATION. THE PROCESS IS MONITORED BY THE SCHOLARSHIP REVIEW COMMITTEE. FOR FEDERAL AND STATE AID, THE PROCESS IS GOVERNED BY A MULTI-STEP REVIEW PROCESS INVOLVING SEVERAL STAFF FROM THE UNIVERSITY'S STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES DEPARTMENT.

DISBURSEMENTS FOR GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY MANAGEMENT PRIOR TO DISBURSEMENT. PERIODIC REPORTS ON THE USE OF THE GRANT FUNDS ARE RECEIVED FROM THE RECIPIENT ORGANIZATION TO ENSURE THAT GRANT FUNDS ARE EXPENDED ACCORDING TO THE STATED PURPOSE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS SCHOLARSHIPS ARE RECONCILED AND MONITORED ON A MONTHLY BASIS AS PART OF NORMAL OPERATING PROCEDURES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE TUITION ASSISTANCE IS GIVEN TO THE STUDENTS IN THE FORM OF A CREDIT TO THEIR ACCOUNT. THE TUITION ASSISTANCE IS NOT PERMITTED TO EXCEED THE STUDENT'S TUITION BILL.
All grants are issued through the UDM Financial Aid office. The FA counselors communicate with students and monitor students' status and educational programs.
THE COLLEGE MAINTAINS A LISTING OF FINANCIAL AID AWARDED TO EACH STUDENT.
INQUIRY AND REVIEW OF CLIENT DOCUMENTATION.
THE ORGANIZATION MAINTAINS A POLICY AND PROCEDURES MANUAL WHICH OUTLINES THE ORGANIZATION'S POLICY ON AWARDING FEDERAL, STATE, AND INSTITUTIONAL ASSISTANCE TO STUDENTS.

Gordon College awards three types of grants/scholarships: merit scholarships, need-based grants and endowment funded restricted scholarships. Merit scholarships are awarded based on the incoming student's academic criteria determined by the Admissions Office. These scholarships are renewed annually by verification of the Registrar's Office that cumulative GPA requirements are met. Need-based grants are awarded based on the student's determined financial need. We determine financial need using information provided by the FAFSA. We practice level-funding of the need-based grants to future years unless there is a significant change in determined financial need. Endowment funded restricted scholarships are awarded based on criteria established by donors. The criteria information on specific eligible students is provided by the Registrar, Admissions and Financial Aid Offices. Students are evaluated annually to verify they continue to meet the donor criteria for an endowment award.

TABOR COLLEGE EVALUATES EACH STUDENT FOR FEDERAL AND STATE FINANCIAL AID USING THE INFORMATION ON THE FAFSA FORM AS WELL AS OTHER APPLICATION MATERIALS COMPLETED FOR THEIR INSTITUTIONAL AID OFFERINGS. STUDENTS MUST MEET ALL DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION GUIDELINES TO RECEIVE FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID, INCLUDING LOANS. SUCH GUIDELINES INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO, SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS, ATTENDANCE, NUMBER OF HOURS, AND A CLEAN FINANCIAL AID HISTORY. STUDENTS MAY BE ELIGIBLE FOR MERIT-BASED AID AND SOME MAY BE ELIGIBLE FOR NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID. IN ADDITION TO BOTH NEED- AND MERIT-BASED QUALIFICATIONS, STUDENTS MUST MEET ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS FOR CERTAIN AID ELEMENTS. ALL DETERMINATIONS ARE MADE BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE IN CONJUNCTION WITH ACADEMIC DEPARTMENTS, ATHLETIC DEPARTMENTS, ADMISSIONS STAFF, AND DEVELOPMENT/ADVANCEMENT STAFF.

ALL GRANT ACTIVITY IS REQUIRED TO MEET THE SPECIFIC STANDARDS AND STIPULATIONS OF THE GRANTOR AND OPERATE WITHIN THE ORGANIZATION'S POLICIES AND PROCEDURES. GRANT REVENUE AND EXPENDITURES ARE MONITORED AND FUNDS ARE DRAWN DOWN ON A MONTHLY BASIS. INTERNAL REPORTS AND AWARD LEVELS ARE REVIEWED PRIOR TO EACH DRAW TO DETERMINE IF CASH SHOULD BE DRAWN FOR INDIVIDUAL GRANTS. FINALLY, THE COLLEGE UNDERGOES AN ANNUAL AUDIT OF ITS FEDERAL AWARDS UNDER THE GUIDELINES OF OMB CIRCULAR A-133.

FUNDS RECEIVED FROM THE MINNESOTA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH FROM LEGISLATION THAT CREATED THE MERC TRUST FUND (PMAP/PGAMC DISTRIBUTION) THAT PROVIDES REMUNERATION FOR THOSE FACILITIES THAT SERVED AS CLINICAL TRAINING SITES FOR THE COLLEGE'S NURSE PRACTITIONER AND CLINICAL NURSE SPECIALIST STUDENTS DURING THE 2012-2013 ACADEMIC YEAR. THE AMOUNTS PAID FROM THE FUNDS RECEIVED FROM THE MERC LEGISLATION TO EACH ORGANIZATION LISTED IN PART II IS BASED ON THE NUMBER OF STUDENTS THEY HAD AND THE LENGTH OF TIME THEY SPENT AT EACH RESPECTIVE FACILITY. TRAINING SITES MUST ALSO HAVE A CURRENT ACTIVE MEDICAL ASSISTANCE ENROLLMENT STATUS IN MINNESOTA.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: The University enters into their computer system (POISE), as budgeted amounts, the amounts that the Department of Education has allocated to be awarded to eligible students. The Financial Aid Department prints out a fund report from POISE that shows the budget amount, how much has been awarded, and how much is available to be awarded. Then the Financial Aid Department awards to each student who has applied for financial aid and meets the University's qualifications, State, and federal guidelines for financial aid the amount that the student is eligible to receive. The amounts that the student receives are credited to their account at the University, then the University automatically deducts tuition, books, and University fees. If there is a balance remaining, it is then refunded to the student. The Financial Aid Department is audited each year by independent certified public accountants.
THE TRUST DOCUMENT SPECIFIES THAT CERTAIN FUNDS ARE TO BE DISTRIBUTED TO THE OTHER TRUSTS AND TO THE COLLEGE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: PRIOR TO JULY 1, 2014 FINANCIAL AID WAS ADMINISTERED THROUGH A SHARED SERVICE AGREEMENT WITH CLAREMONT SCHOOL OF THEOLOGY. SCHOLARSHIPS WERE GRANTED TO STUDENTS BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED OR MERIT FINANCIAL NEED. QUALIFICATIONS INCLUDED DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED PER THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION FFSA, WHICH WAS UPDATED ANNUALLY. MERIT BASED SCHOLARSHIPS WERE MONITORED FOR GRADE-POINT AVERAGE AND OTHER SIGNALS OF ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE. ALL NEED BASED RECORDS WERE MAINTAINED BY CST'S OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID AND MERIT BASED SCHOLARSHIPS WERE MAINTAINED BY CST'S OFFICE OF ADMISSION. THE UNIVERSITY REVIEWED ALL AWARDS AND HAD ACCESS TO ALL THE RECORDS. ON JULY 1, 2014, WHEN CLAREMONT LINCOLN UNIVERSITY SEPARATED FROM CLAREMONT SCHOOL OF THEOLOGY, CLU ELECTED TO NOT PARTICIPATE IN THE FEDERAL TITLE IV FUNDING PROGRAM.

CARROLL COLLEGE AND FEDERAL NEED-BASED GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON THE RESULTS OF THE FEDERAL FAFSA AND NEEDS ANALYSIS. NEW STUDENT MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BASED ON HIGH SCHOOL GPA AND TEST SCORES OR TRANSFER GPA FOR TRANSFER STUDENTS. STATE GRANT REPORTING IS COMPLETED EACH YEAR AFTER THE ACADEMIC YEAR IS COMPLETED. FEDERAL FISAP REPORTING IS COMPLETED PRIOR TO OCTOBER OF EACH YEAR FOLLOWING THE COMPLETION OF THE ACADEMIC YEAR.

Students submit the Federal FAFSA and this form is reviewed to award scholarships and other tuition discounts. Students also receive awards based on service (athletics) as well as academic or extracurricular achievements. The Director of Financial Aid and the VP of Enrollment maintain appropriate records to substantiate any financial assistance students receive. That information is subject to annual audit under OMB A-133 for any federal money the school receives. Awards are credited to students accounts. Accounts are reconciled throughout the year.
ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE PROVIDED AS A CREDIT TO THE STUDENT TO COVER CHARGES OF TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD, AND OTHER FEES RELATED TO THE COST OF ATTENDANCE.

ANY SCHOLARSHIPS/GRANTS TO STUDENTS ARE DETERMINED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE IN WHICH EACH STUDENT FILE IS REVIEWED IN ACCORDANCE WITH DESIGNATED ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS OF THE SCHOLARSHIPS OR GRANTS. SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE THEN MONITORED BY DISBURSING FUNDS FROM THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNT OFFICE.

THE NEWSEUM INSTITUTE OFFERS SEVERAL SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS DURING THE YEAR. MONITORING OF THESE FUNDS IS NOT REQUIRED AS THE GRANTS ARE ONLY MADE TO THOSE INDIVIDUALS WHO PARTICIPATE IN THE INSTITUTE'S CLASSES.

THE AWARDS ARE DETERMINED AND CANDIDATES SELECTED BY THE K-STATE GRADUATE SCHOOL. THE GRADUATE SCHOOL REQUESTS THE FUNDS FROM KSURF AS NEAR AS POSSIBLE TO THE BEGINNING OF APPLICABLE SCHOOL TERM AND THE FUNDS ARE DEPOSITED INTO A RESTRICTED FEES ACCOUNT. THE FUNDS USED FOR SCHOLARSHIPS ARE TRACKED IN A SEPARATE GL ACCOUNT FOR THE RESERVE AND THIS IS WHERE THE DETAIL OF USE OF THE FUNDS IS TRACKED.

ExplntnTxt: MERCY COLLEGE OF OHIO FOLLOWS THE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES OF THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION FOR TITLE IV GRANTS AND THE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES OF THE OHIO BOARD OF REGENTS FOR ALL STATE GRANTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: MERCY COLLEGE OF OHIO FOLLOWS THE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES OF THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION FOR TITLE IV GRANTS AND THE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES OF THE OHIO BOARD OF REGENTS FOR ALL STATE GRANTS.

The College follows state and federal guidelines in providing financial aid to students as well as internal criteria based upon academic progress, criteria established by particular scholarships, and/or financial need. The federal FAFSA form is used in this process as well.
ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DETERIMINED BY THE COLLEGE'S ASSESMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, OR OTHER CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY THE DONOR OR INSTITUTION.

STUDENTS INTERESTED IN A SCHOLARSHIP MUST APPLY THROUGH A WRITTEN APPLICATION PROCESS. ALL APPLICATIONS ARE THEN REVIEWED BY A SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE THAT AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS ACCORDING TO WHETHER OR NOT THE APPLICANT MEETS THE CRITERIA FOR THE SCHOLARSHIP (FOR EXAMPLE, IF THE ENDOWMENT SCHOLARSHIP SPECIFIES THAT RECIPIENTS MUST BE FROM INNER-CITY DETROIT, ONLY THOSE WHO ARE SO ARE CONSIDERED) AND THEN BASED ON NEED VERSUS AVAILABLE FUNDS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: STUDENTS ARE AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON AN EVALUATION OF NEED AND ELIGIBILITY FOR SPECIFIC AWARDS IN ACCORDANCE WITH ANY DONOR STIPULATIONS. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR MAKING SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS AND FOR MONITORING ONGOING ELIGIBILITY (E.G. MAINTENANCE OF SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS).
SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED TO STUDENTS ARE AUTOMATICALLY CREDITED TO THEIR ACCOUNT WITH THE UNIVERSITY TO OFFSET TUITION AND OTHER SIMILIAR COSTS. NO CASH IS AWARDED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS.
THE FOUNDATION GRANTS AMOUNTS DIRECTLY TO THE VIRGINIA COMMONWEALTH UNIVERSITY (UNIVERSITY). ALL FUNDS ARE USED DIRECTLY IN COMPLETING THE EDUCATIONAL PURPOSE OF THE UNIVERSITY.
Funds are awarded to students eligible to receive financial aid in accordance with federal guidelines.

All scholarships and grants are awarded to students based on superior academic or athletic achievement and financial need. These scholarships and grant are posted directly to the student's account to be applied against charges for tuition, fees, room, and board.

THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID SERVICES AWARDS FINANCIAL AID IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE HIGHER EDUCATION ACT. FEDERAL AND STATE AWARDING GUIDELINES ARE USED IN AWARDING STUDENT'S FINANCIAL AID. STUDENT'S ACCOUNTS ARE REVIEWED ON A BI-WEEKLY BASIS TO ENSURE THAT ALL STUDENTS ARE CURRENTLY ENROLLED ACCORDING TO APPROPRIATE GUIDELINES. A QUALITY CONTROL CHECK IS IN PLACE IN THAT A FILE AUDIT IS PERFORMED OF A RANDOM SAMPLE OF FILES TO ENSURE THAT PROPER PROCEDURES ARE BEING FOLLOWED. AN ANNUAL AUDIT IS PERFORMED BY AN OUTSIDE COMPANY TO ENSURE THAT THERE ARE NO GROSS VIOLATIONS OF FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATIONS.
All expenditures are reviewed by the Executive Director before advancement

THE ORGANIZATION HAS DESIGNED AND IMPLEMENTED INTERNAL CONTROLS OVER COMPLIANCE WITH GRANTS AND CONTRACTS REQUIREMENTS. THE ORGANIZATION IS ALSO SUBJECT TO AN ANNUAL OMB CIRCULAR A-133 AUDIT, AS WELL AS SEFA, WHICH TESTS THE ORGANIZATION'S INTERNAL CONTROLS OVER COMPLIANCE FOR FEDERAL GRANT COMPLIANCE REQUIREMENTS.
ALL GRANTS RECEIVED BY GEORGIA REGENTS RESEARCH INSTITUTE, INC. ARE SUBCONTRACTED TO GEORGIA REGENTS UNIVERSITY.

ORGANIZATION'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANTS STUDENT FINANCIAL AID APPLICATIONS ARE REVIEWED ANNUALLY IN ORDER TO ENSURE GRANT FUNDS ARE AWARDED APPROPRIATELY BASED ON THE INDIVIDUAL AWARD CRITERIA.

GRANT RECIPIENTS ARE STUDENTS ENROLLED IN THE MASTER OF DIVINITY PROGRAM AND ARE CHOSEN BASED ON NUMBER OF CREDIT HOURS COMPLETED IN THE DEGREE PROGRAM, NUMBER OF CREDIT HOURS TAKEN EACH TERM, AND FINANCIAL NEED.

FINANCIAL AID APPLICATIONS ARE PROCESSED AND MONITORED BY THE BUSINESS OFFICE. ENDOWMENT SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS AND ENTITLEMENT AWARDS ARE COORDINATED AND MONITORED BY THE BUSINESS OFFICE. ALL FINANCIAL AID OFFERS ARE REVIEWED BY THE ADMINISTRATIVELY APPOINTED STUDENT FINANCE COMMITTEE. WORK STUDY POSITIONS ARE OFFERED AND REGULATED BY THE PERSONNEL OFFICER IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE FACULTY MEMBER OR ADMINISTRATIVE SUPERVISOR.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 - Org.'s Proc. for Mon. the Use of Grant Funds
ExplntnTxt: Although IU Health Arnett does not monitor the use of grant funds once distributed, through due diligence the organization has reasonably confirmed that the entities to which the contributions are made are highly reputable in the community and use the funds for the purposes intended.
The Financial Aid office monitors the awards of all federal student aid grants.

THE AWARDING OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID GRANTS UNDER THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION'S STUDENT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM ARE MONITORED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, WHICH ENSURES THAT THE UNIVERSITY MEETS THE COMPLIANCE REQUIREMENTS OF OMB CIRCULAR A-133. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ESTABLISHING AND MAINTAINING EFFECTIVE INTERNAL CONTROL OVER COMPLIANCE WITH THE REQUIREMENTS OF LAWS, REGULATIONS, CONTRACTS, AND GRANTS APPLICABLE TO FEDERAL PROGRAMS. ADMINISTRATION OF GRANT ACTIVITIES IS COORDINATED BETWEEN THE ACADEMIC OFFICE OF RESEARCH AND SPONSORED PROJECTS, THE UNIVERSITY ADVANCEMENT OFFICE, AND THE BUSINESS OFFICE. THESE OFFICES ENSURE THAT APPROPRIATE CONTROLS ARE ESTABLISHED AND THAT GRANT REQUIREMENTS FOR DOCUMENTATION, TRACKING, EXPENDITURE OF FUNDS, AND REPORTING ARE MET.

ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE ADMINISTERED WITHIN THE GUIDELINES OF THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION. WILLIAM CAREY UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID AND BUSINESS DEPARTMENTS MONITOR THE PROGRAMS TO ASSURE THAT THEY FOLLOW FEDERAL GUIDELINES. THE INDEPENDENT AUDITORS PERFORM AN AUDIT ON ALL FEDERAL PROGRAMS ANNUALLY.

USE OF GRANT FUNDS: THE COLLEGE HAS IN PLACE ASSURANCES/SAFEGUARDS THAT INCLUDE GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING STANDARDS, AND ADDITIONAL FISCAL PROCEDURES FOR THE SUBMISSION AND APPROVAL OF INVOICES FOR THE PROPER USE OF GRANT FUNDS. FOR EXPENDITURES THAT PROVIDE SPECIFIC ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS (IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND OTHER FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO PAY FOR TUITION, SUPPLIES AND FEES), THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE KEEPS COMPLETE AND ACCURATE INFORMATION ON EACH INDIVIDUAL RECIPIENT THAT INCLUDES DATA ON ELIGIBILITY, ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AND AMOUNT OF FUNDS AWARDED/DISBURSED. FOR EXPENDITURES IN SUPPORT OF PROGRAMMATIC ACTIVITIES PROGRAM MANAGERS MUST REVIEW EXPENDITURE REQUESTS TO ENSURE THAT EACH IS AN APPROPRIATE EXPENDITURE FOR APPROVED ACTIVITIES IN THE APPROVED BUDGET FOR THE GRANT.

INITIAL MERIT AID FOR NEW FIRST YEAR AND TRANSFER FULL TIME DAY STUDENTS IS DETERMINED BY VARIABLES SUCH AS ACT TEST SCORES, HIGH SCHOOL GPA, TOP % OF HIGH SCHOOL CLASS, AND TRANSFER GPA. THIS INFORMATION IS DATA ENTERED INTO THE SOFTWARE AND THEN A FACTOR IS DETERMINED. THAT FACTOR DETERMINES THE MERIT AID THE STUDENT IS ELIGIBLE FOR. RULES IN THE SOFTWARE ALERT MANUAL AWARD ENTRY ERROR. RENEWAL OF MERIT AID IS DETERMINED AT THE TIME OF AWARDING THE AID FOR THE NEXT YEAR BY REVIEWING GRAND VIEW GPA AND SEMESTERS OF RECEIVED AID. AS A FOLLOW-UP FOR THOSE AWARDED PRIOR TO THE SPRING GRADES, A REPORT IS REVIEWED TO DETERMINE IF THE GPA CRITERIA WAS MET AT THE END OF THE TERM. GRAND VIEW IS A MEMBER OF THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF INTERCOLLEGIATE ATHLETICS AND OFFERS ATHLETIC SCHOLARSHIPS IN BASEBALL, BASKETBALL, BOWLING, CROSS COUNTRY, FOOTBALL, GOLF, SOCCER, TRACK AND FIELD, WRESTLING, VOLLEYBALL AND TENNIS FOR MEN, AND BASKETBALL, BOWLING, COMPETITIVE DANCE, CROSS COUNTRY, GOLF, SOCCER, SOFTBALL, TRACK AND FIELD, VOLLEYBALL AND TENNIS FOR WOMEN. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BASED ON ABILITY AS EVALUATED BY THE COACHES. TO QUALIFY, STUDENTS MUST VISIT CAMPUS, INTERVIEW WITH AND BE RECOMMENDED BY THE COACH, APPLY AND BE ACCEPTED TO THE UNIVERSITY. COACHES ARE GIVEN A BUDGET FOR THE YEAR TO RECRUIT AND RETAIN PLAYERS. APPEALS FOR ADDITIONAL DOLLARS ARE MONITORED BY THE ATHLETIC DIRECTOR AND VICE PRESIDENT FOR ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT. BUDGETS ARE MONITORED BY ATHLETIC ADMINISTRATIVE COORDINATOR, ATHLETIC DIRECTOR, FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR, AND VICE PRESIDENT FOR ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT. ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS ARE REVIEWED BY THE ATHLETIC SUCCESS COORDINATOR AND THE ATHLETIC DIRECTOR. COMMUNICATION OF STUDENT AWARDS IS DONE VIA EMAIL BETWEEN THE ATHLETIC ADMINISTRATIVE COORDINATOR AND FINANCIAL AID. ART, MUSIC & THEATER AWARDS ARE AWARDED TO FULL TIME DAY STUDENTS WHO DEMONSTRATE TALENT. TO QUALIFY, STUDENTS MUST VISIT CAMPUS, MEET WITH THE CHAIR OF THE DEPARTMENT, APPLY AND BE ACCEPTED TO GRAND VIEW. RENEWAL IS BASED ON GPA OR GOOD STANDING. EACH DEPARTMENT HAS A BUDGET TO USE TO RECRUIT AND RETAIN STUDENTS. COMMUNICATIONS FOR INITIAL AWARDS ARE GIVEN TO THE ADMISSIONS DIRECTOR AND FORWARDED TO THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR. ROSTERS OF THOSE TO RENEW ARE SENT TO THE CHAIR TO EVALUATE BASED ON GPA, ACADEMIC STANDING AND PARTICIPATION. BUDGETS ARE MONITORED BY FINANCIAL AID. AN ALERT WILL BE GIVEN IF AN AWARD IS ENTERED OVER THE BUDGETED AMOUNT. ANNUAL AND ENDOWED AID IS AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON DONOR QUALIFICATIONS. ADVANCEMENT, BUSINESS OFFICE, AND FINANCIAL AID SIGN OFF AND RECEIVE COPIES OF NEW FUNDS CREATED. THE ASSISTANT DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID WORKS WITH THE BUSINESS OFFICE AND ADVANCEMENT TO DETERMINE WHICH FUNDS AND THE DOLLAR AMOUNT TO BE AWARDED IN A GIVEN YEAR IN JANUARY. NOTIFICATIONS GO TO DEPARTMENTS OF FACULTY PICKS. FINANCIAL AID PICKS ARE DETERMINED BY RUNNING A REPORT TO GET STUDENTS WHO MEET DONOR REQUIREMENTS. MOST OF THESE AWARDS REQUIRE A SCHOLARSHIP ACCEPTANCE AND THANK YOU TO THE DONOR. DISBURSEMENT RULES WILL NOT ALLOW THE FUND TO BE DISBURSED UNTIL THIS DOCUMENTATION IS RECEIVED. PACKAGING PROCEDURES ARE DEVELOPED EACH YEAR AND UTILIZED TO DETERMINE A STUDENT'S TOTAL FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE. IN THIS WAY, AID IS GIVEN IN A FAIR AND EQUITABLE MANNER.
Scholarships are awarded on a merit and need base up to the amount charged on a reportable system.

GRANTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS. THE COLLEGE MONITORS STUDENT TUITION ACCOUNTS FOR ANY STUDENT WHO RECEIVED A SCHOLARSHIP OR TUITION CREDIT. THE BURSAR'S OFFICE AND THE ADMISSIONS OFFICE ENSURE THAT STUDENTS WHO RECEIVE SCHOLARSHIPS OR TUITION CREDITS MAINTAIN FULL-TIME OR PART-TIME STUDENT STATUS AND MEET ALL OTHER REQUIREMENTS, AS REQUIRED BY THE AWARDED SCHOLARSHIP, SO THAT THE FUNDS ARE USED FOR THEIR INTENDED PURPOSE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Description Of Procedure For Monitoring Use Of Grant Funds
ExplntnTxt: All student scholarships, grants, or other assistance are monitored throughout the award, acceptance, and application processes. Appropriate records are maintained and documented.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: All student scholarships, grants, or other assistance are monitored throughout the award, acceptance, and application processes. Appropriate records are maintained and documented.
THE COLLEGE VERIFIES THAT THE RECIPIENT MEETS THE GUIDELINES OF EACH SPECIFIC AWARD. THE COLLEGE APPLIES GRANT MONIES DIRECTLY TO STUDENT BALANCES.
GRANTS & SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED FOR APPROPRIATE USE BY VALIDATING REGISTRATION AND SATISFACTORY PROGRESS TOWARDS COMPLETION OF EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS.

SCHOLARSHIP AMOUNTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AFTER A THOROUGH REVIEW OF ELIGIBILITY AND SELECTION CRITERIA. THE UNIVERSITY HAS AN EXPERIENCED FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT THAT MONITORS THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS.

The Director of Financial Aid reviews each endowment scholarship award criteria and awards scholarships based on donor intent. Merit scholarships are awarded by the Director of Financial Aid based on a review of the ACT scores and incoming GPA.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Description Of Procedure For Monitoring Use Of Grant Funds
ExplntnTxt: Scholarships and tuition assistance are applied directly to students' tuition accounts. No cash is given to students.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Scholarships and tuition assistance are applied directly to students' tuition accounts. No cash is given to students.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE OFFICE OF ADVANCEMENT WORKS WITH DONORS TO ESTABLISH GUIDELINES FOR THE USE AND DISBURSEMENT OF ANY DONATED FUNDS ACCORDING TO THE DONOR'S WISHES AND WITHIN PRACTICAL AND LEGAL PROCESSES. THE DONOR'S RESTRICTIONS ("WISHES") ARE PUT IN WRITING WITH COPIES MAINTAINED IN THE ADVANCEMENT OFFICE, THE CONTROLLER'S OFFICE, AND THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, IF APPLICABLE. IF THE DONATION IS FOR GRANTS OR SCHOLARSHIPS TO BE DISTRIBTED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAINTAINS A SPREADSHEET OF GRANT TITLES AND RESTRICTIONS WHICH ARE UPDATED AS NEEDED AS WELL AS A PERMANENT ELECTRONIC FILE. THE GRANTS OR SCHOLARSHIPS ARE "MATCHED" WITH AN ELIGIBLE RECIPIENT BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. THE ADVANCEMENT OFFICE WILL RECEIVE A LIST OF THESE RECIPIENTS IN THE FALL AND AN UPDATED LIST IN THE EARLY SPRING. THE ADVANCEMENT OFFICE REVIEWS THE LIST AND PREPARES LUNCHEON INVITATIONS FOR MOST OF THE RECIPIENTS AND DONORS. THE FINAL STEP IN THE PROCESS IS A RANDOM AUDIT CONDUCTED ONCE A YEAR BY AN OUTSIDE AUDIT FIRM.

NEED-BASED GRANTS WERE AWARDED TO WARREN WILSON COLLEGE STUDENTS BASED ON FAFSA (FREE APPLICATION FOR STUDENT AID) RESULTS. FAFSA RESULTS ARE NOT REQUIRED TO BE CONSIDERED FOR MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS, BUT MANY OF THESE DOLLARS WERE USED TO MEET THE FEDERAL DEFINITION OF 'NEED'.

FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS AT THE UNIVERSITY ARE FUNDED THROUGH A VARIETY OF SOURCES. IT IS INTENDED THAT THE VARIOUS FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS BE USED TO RECOGNIZE ACADEMIC, ATHLETIC, SERVANT LEADERSHIP, AND SPECIAL ACHIEVEMENT MEET FINANCIAL NEEDS OR PROVIDE SELF-HELP OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH STUDENT WORK-STUDY PROGRAMS AND PARENT/STUDENT LOANS. WHILE IT IS NOT POSSIBLE TO GUARANTEE THAT FUNDING WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR EVERY NEEDY APPLICANT, THE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS AT THE UNIVERSITY ARE DESIGNED TO HELP COVER THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE DIRECT COST OF ATTENDING THE UNIVERSITY AND THE STUDENTS OWN RESOURCES. EACH APPLICATION IS REVIEWED BASED UPON AN INDIVIDUAL ASSESSMENT IN ORDER TO DETERMINE THE TYPE OF RESOURCES THAT WILL BEST SERVE THE STUDENT.

GRANT EXPENDITURES ARE AUTHORIZED BY THE PI; ACCOUNTING DEPT VERIFIES EXP BEFORE DRAWING FUNDS. GRANTS APPLICABLE TO EACH PROGRAM WITH STANDARDS SET FORTH IN OMB CIRCULAR A-133. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE GRANTS TO STUDENTS AND ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT BY THE UNIVERSITY.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS TO U.S. MANAGEMENT DETERMINES THE ANNUAL GUIDELINE AMOUNT OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND DISCOUNTS. AWARDS ARE BASED ON VARIOUS CRITERIA AND TRACKED WITH BOARD APPROVED BUDGET. MONTHLY GENERATED REPORTS ARE USED TO MONITOR AWARDS PROGRAM. INDEPENDENT AUDITORS REVIEW ACCURACY OF FINANCIAL AID AWARDS AND RECIPIENTS' RECORDS. FUNDS ARE DISTRIBUTED BASED ON NEED AND MERIT. STUDENT AID IS HANDLED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AND CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNT. EACH STUDENT APPLIES FOR FINANCIAL AID BY FILLING OUT A FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). THE AWARD IS BASED ON THE INFORMATION IN THIS APPLICATION. STUDENTS CAN ALSO APPLY FOR GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON ELIGIBILITY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Description Of Procedure For Monitoring Use Of Grant Funds
ExplntnTxt: All scholarships are offered based on manual and or electronic verification of eligibility criteria. The system disbursement of the scholarships to the student's account occurs only after global and item type specific disbursement eligibility rules are met. Upon disbursement, payment allocation rules in the system allocate the scholarships to appropriate predefined charges. After disbursement audits are done at various time intervals to determine continued eligibility.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: All scholarships are offered based on manual and or electronic verification of eligibility criteria. The system disbursement of the scholarships to the student's account occurs only after global and item type specific disbursement eligibility rules are met. Upon disbursement, payment allocation rules in the system allocate the scholarships to appropriate predefined charges. After disbursement audits are done at various time intervals to determine continued eligibility.

ELIGIBILITY FOR NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS IS DETERMINED ANNUALLY BASED UPON THE RESULTS OF THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED UPON ENROLLMENT AND ELIGIBILITY IS FOR THE EIGHT SEMESTERS. AT THE END OF EACH SEMESTER, THE FINANCIAL PLANNING DEPARTMENT VERIFIES SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS HAS BEEN MAINTAINED IN ORDER TO DETERMINE CONTINUATION OF ALL SCHOLARSHIPS.

LINCOLN MEDICAL EDUCATION PARTNERSHIP PROVIDES GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS LOCATED IN THE STATE OF NEBRASKA. GRANTS ARE AWARDED AS PER STUDY PROTOCOLS (FOR CANCER RESEARCH) OR ON A LIMITED BASIS TO PARTICIPANTS IN STEPPING STONES FOR FAMILIES PROGRAM.

INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE GRANTED BY THE BOARD, AUTHORIZED BY THE DEAN, AND AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO DEMONSTRATE FINANCIAL NEED. THESE FUNDS ARE DEDUCTED FROM STUDENT TUITION. THE INSTITUTE MONITORS STUDENT ACCOUNTS TO DETERMINE ENROLLMENT AND ELIGIBILITY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: For all scholarship funds, student financial services has established specific criteria in regards to eligibility and selection. The eligibility requirements of the students are documented and monitored for compliance. The actual scholarships are credited to the student's tuition bills. No scholarships or grants are awarded directly to the recipients.

Grants to individuals: The University provides financial assistance to students that submit a written application and meet the University's criteria for financial assistance. Applications are reviewed by the Financial Aid Department and/or scholarship committees, depending upon the particular terms of each scholarship. Awards are applied against the student's tuition due to the University. The University monitors each student to assure that he/she remains enrolled in school and continues to satisfy the criteria for his/her specific scholarship. If the student withdraws from the University, then any remaining funds are returned to the scholarship pool to be awarded to another student.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: STUDENT FINANCIAL AID PROCEDURES TYPICALLY FOLLOWED BY COLLEGES IN THE UNITED STATES USING FAFSA AND THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID APPLICATION CRITERIA. FEDERAL GRANTS ARE SUBJECT TO THE SINGLE AUDIT ACT OF THE UNITED STATES.

SCHEDULE I, PART III - SCHOLARSHIPSHIPS/STUDENT AID GRANTS - INCLUDES PRIMARILY ROOM AND BOARD, BOOKS AND SUPPLIES ASSISTANCE. THE AMOUNT OF TUITION SCHOLARSHIPS/STUDENT AID FOR THE YEAR WAS 7,025,785.
The Financial Aid Director determines and monitors the use of grant funds in the United States.

HESSTON COLLEGE EVALUATES EACH STUDENT FOR FEDERAL AND STATE FINANCIAL AID USING THE INFORMATION ON THE FAFSA FORM AS WELL AS OTHER APPLICATION MATERIALS COMPLETED FOR THEIR INSTITUTIONAL AID OFFERINGS. STUDENTS MUST MEET ALL DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION GUIDELINES TO RECEIVE FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID, INCLUDING LOANS. SUCH GUIDELINES INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO, SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS, ATTENDANCE, NUMBER OF HOURS, AND A CLEAN FINANCIAL AID HISTORY. STUDENTS MAY BE ELIGIBLE FOR MERIT-BASED AID AND SOME MAY BE ELIGIBLE FOR NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID. IN ADDITION TO BOTH NEED- AND MERIT-BASED QUALIFICATIONS, STUDENTS MUST MEET ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS FOR CERTAIN AID ELEMENTS. ALL DETERMINATIONS ARE MADE BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE IN CONJUNCTION WITH ACADEMIC DEPARTMENTS, ATHLETIC DEPARTMENTS, ADMISSIONS STAFF, AND DEVELOPMENT/ADVANCEMENT STAFF.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Description Of Procedure For Monitoring Use Of Grant Funds
ExplntnTxt: All grants are in the form of scholarships and are applied toward the cost of tuition only.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: All grants are in the form of scholarships and are applied toward the cost of tuition only.

LIPSCOMB UNIVERSITY HAS AN ANNUAL AUDIT OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND AN ANNUAL AUDIT OF ITS FINANCIAL AID AWARDING PROCESS (CALLED THE OMB CIRCULAR A-133 AUDIT). IN ADDITION, FINANCIAL AID COUNSELORS ATTEND CONFERENCES AND TRAINING SESSIONS ON FINANCIAL AID AWARDING POLICIES, PROCEDURES, AND CONTROLS.

THE UNIVERSITY HAS CONTROLS IN PLACE TO MONITOR THE USE OF ALL GRANT FUNDS. THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO STUDENTS MATRICULATING AT THE UNIVERSITY. THE DEVELOPMENT AND FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENTS REVIEW OVERALL USE OF SCHOLARHSIP AND OTHER GRANT FUNDS TO ENSURE THAT THE RECIPIENTS ARE ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE THE FUNDS. ALL FUNDS ISSUED TO THE STUDENTS ARE REQUIRED TO DEFRAY THE COST OF TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD. SINCE THE STUDENTS HAVE NO DISCRETION IN THE USE OF THE FUNDS, THE UNIVERSITY HAS NO NEED TO MONITOR THE GRANTS ONCE THEY ARE ISSUED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON NEED, ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, AND/OR ENROLLMENT STATUS. SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS (SAP) IS THE MEANS USED TO MONITOR THE SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED. SAP MEASURES BOTH QUALITATIVE AND QUANTITATIVE PROGRESS. THE AWARDS ARE USED FOR TUITION, ROOM, AND BOARD.

THE UNIVERSITY DETERMINES THE ELIGIBILITY FOR EACH STUDENT'S NEEDS AND THE AWARDS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. THE UNIVERSITY MONITORS THE STUDENT'S CONTINUED ELIGIBILITY TO RECEIVE THE ASSISTANCE.

HODGES UNIVERSITY PARTICIPATES IN VARIOUS LOCAL SPONSORSHIPS TO ORGANIZATIONS ANNUALLY BASED ON OUR ABILITY AND CURRENT ECONOMIC SITUATION. BECAUSE THE SPONSORSHIPS ARE FOR GENERAL OPERATING SUPPORT, NO MONITORING IS REQUIRED. HODGES UNIVERSITY PARTICIPATES IN BOTH STATE AND FEDERAL STUDENT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS. VIRTUALLY ALL FUNDS RECEIVED ARE IMMEDIATELY CREDITED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS FOR PAYMENT OF TUITION, FEES AND BOOKS. EXCESS FUNDS ARE DELIVERED TO STUDENTS ACCORDING TO PROGRAM REQUIREMENTS.
ALL GRANTS ARE PAID TO A RELATED ORGANIZATION. GRANT FUNDS ARE MONITORED ACCORDING TO THE INTERNAL STANDARDS OF THE RELATED ORGANIZATION.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Scholarships are granted to deserving students based on the terms of the grant establishing the particular scholarship fund. For example, some scholarships are available only to students in the Missions Department, or Music majors, etc., while some scholarships funds can be given to any student who can show a need.Scholarships and grants are placed on student receivable accounts except in a few exceptional cases. If there is a credit balance left on the student account no amounts are refunded until any unused scholarships or grants are reversed.

THE COLLEGE'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS REQUIRES THE VERIFICATION OF 1) ENROLLMENT STATUS, 2) NUMBER OF HOURS ENROLLED, 3) NUMBER OF EARNED CREDIT HOURS, 4) GPA, AND 5) HOUSING STATUS. IN ADDITION, A REVIEW OF STUDENT ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IS CONDUCTED EACH SEMESTER TO DETERMINE OVERALL STANDING IN RELATION TO THE COLLEGE'S ESTABLISHED SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC POLICY (SAP).

The federal aid office of the University requires students to complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) form to determine eligibility for Federal, State, and Institutional grants, scholarships, and loans. This is an equitable formula that measures all assets consistently. In addition to this form, the Institution does require some other guidelines in the event that funds are offered based upon certain academic credentials or performance in a University sponsored activity. These credentials are clearly stated in the University catalog and the University website. Enrollment and eligibility are monitored by the University.
STUDENT FINANCIAL AID IS MONITORED BY INSTITUTIONAL GUIDELINES AND A COMMITTEE OF EMPLOYEES WITH RESPONSIBILITY TO ENSURE THE INSTRUCTION GUIDELINES ARE PROPERLY FOLLOWED.

Grants and aid are tracked in the accounting system in a temporarily restricted fund or reimbursed according to a qualified reimbursement policy. An audit of funds granted is conducted when deemed necessary.

THE UNIVERSITY ATTEMPTS TO MAKE ADEQUATE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AVAILABLE TO STUDENTS WITHIN THE LIMITS OF EACH STUDENT BUDGET AND THE AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS. AWARDS ARE BASED ON ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, PROFESSIONAL PROMISE, LEADERSHIP POTENTIAL, FINANCIAL NEED AND/OR SPECIFIC GUIDELINES ESTABLISHED BY DONORS. FINANCIAL NEED IS DETERMINED ON THE BASIS OF INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). ADDITIONALLY, THE UNIVERSITY MAKES AVAILABLE FEDERAL WORK STUDY FUNDS TO STUDENTS IN WHICH ELIGIBLE AWARD AMOUNTS ARE ALSO BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED INFORMATION PROVIDED WITHIN THE FAFSA. WORK STUDY EXPENDED AND AVAILABLE FUNDS ARE TRACKED AND REVIEWED THROUGHOUT THE YEAR. THE UNIVERSITY ALSO ASSISTED BY PROVIDING FUNDS FOR GENERAL OPERATIONAL SUPPORT TO THE HEALTH EDUCATION AND RESIDENCY TRAINING NETWORK, A CHARITABLE ORGANIZATION ESTABLISHED TO PROMOTE AND SUPPORT COLLABORATION OF MEMBER MEDICAL AND EDUCATION INSTITUTIONS IN EDUCATION AND TRAINING FOR MEDICAL STUDENTS,INTERNS AND RESIDENTS.

DISBURSEMENTS TO STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL AID ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH INSTITUTIONAL PROCEDURES TO ENSURE THAT THOSE RECEIVING AID ARE QUALIFYING RECIPIENTS. FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID OR ASSISTANCE FROM A GOVERNMENTAL AGENCY IS DISTRIBUTED TO STUDENTS USING FEDERALLY APPROVED FINANCIAL NEED ANALYSIS CRITERIA.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Use of grant funds are monitored by the Business Office, Financil Aid Department and Grant Coordinator, if applicable, to determine that required criteria are met.
GRANTS ARE ISSUED TO COVER THE EDUCATION COST OF THE WCMS PROGRAM. GRANTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE INVOICE; NO DISBURSEMENTS ARE MADE TO PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS.
THE COLLEGE OF FELLOWS REQUIRES TWO REPORTS EACH YEAR FROM THE RECIPIENTS. THOSE REPORTS ARE REVIEWED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE.

DISBURSEMENTS TO STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL AID ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH INSTITUTIONAL PROCEDURES TO ENSURE THAT THOSE RECEIVING THE AID ARE QUALIFYING RECIPIENTS. THESE RECIPIENTS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY ASSESSING THEIR ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF SCHOLASTIC ABILITY, PERSONAL PRESENTATION SKILLS AND FINANCIAL NEED. STUDENTS MUST MAINTAIN A MINIMUM GPA OF 2.5 TO QUALIFY FOR CONSIDERATION FOR ANY ADDITIONAL SCHOLARSHIP FUNDING.

FUNDS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT FOR TUITION AND FEES, ROOM AND BOARD, BOOKS AND OTHER SCHOOL RELATED SUPPLIES. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT WORKS CLOSELY WITH THE BURSAR TO ENSURE THAT FUNDS ARE CREDITED TO THE PROPER ACCOUNT AND PROPERLY UTILIZED TO STAY IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE GRANT'S RESTRICTIONS.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE PURSUING A DEGREE OFFERED BY ALLEN COLLEGE AND MEET THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS OF PARTICULAR SCHOLARSHIPS. A SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE CONSISTING OF REPRESENTATIVES FROM ALLEN COLLEGE AND THE MEMORIAL FOUNDATION OF ALLEN HOSPITAL REVIEW APPLICATIONS AND SELECT INDIVIDUALS WHO QUALIFY.

THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT GIVE ANY NON-CASH SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED TO STUDENTS THROUGH CREDITING THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS. IF THE STUDENT HAS EXCESS SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS AS THE RESULT OF TITLE IV AID, THEN THESE FUNDS ARE AUTOMATICALLY DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK WITHIN FOURTEEN DAYS. IF THE EXCESS FUNDS ARE THE RESULT OF SOMETHING OTHER THAN TITLE IV AID, THE STUDENT MUST REQUEST A REFUND AND THESE FUNDS ARE DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK. THE UNIVERSITY'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S. ARE AS FOLLOWS: THE UNIVERSITY HAS APPOINTED DIRECTORS, WHO REPORT TO THE APPROPRIATE VICE PRESIDENTS OVER ALL FEDERAL GRANT PROGRAMS. THESE DIRECTORS ARE CHARGED WITH PERFORMING ALL GRANT-RELATED ACTIVITIES INCLUDING APPLICATION, MONITORING OF EXPENDITURES AND REPORTING, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF DRAW-DOWNS OF FEDERAL FUNDS. DRAW-DOWNS ARE PERFORMED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S CONTROLLER AFTER REQUESTS ARE MADE BY THE DIRECTOR TO THE CONTROLLER. THE CONTROLLER REVIEWS THE REQUESTS FOR DRAW-DOWNS, WHICH INCLUDE DOCUMENTATION OF ALL DIRECT AND INDIRECT PROGRAM EXPENSES, BEFORE MAKING THE DRAW-DOWNS. A SINGLE AUDIT IS PERFORMED ANNUALLY BY THE UNIVERSITY'S INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.

DRAKE UNIVERSITY HAS EMPLOYEES DEDICATED TO POST-AWARD REVIEW AND COMPLIANCE FOR ALL FEDERAL, STATE, AND PRIVATE GRANTS RECEIVED. IN ADDITION, DRAKE RECEIVES AN A-133 AUDIT ON AN ANNUAL BASIS FROM OUR EXTERNAL AUDIT FIRM. OUR FY13 A-133 AUDIT EXPRESSED AN UNQUALIFIED OPINION WITH NO FINDINGS, NO SIGNIFICANT DEFICIENCIES IN INTERNAL CONTROL, AND NO INSTANCES OF MATERIAL NONCOMPLIANCE.

COE COLLEGE RECEIVES VARIOUS FEDERAL GRANTS FROM NSF, DEPT OF EDUCATION AND OTHER AGENCIES OR BRANCHES OF THE US GOVERNMENT. SEPARATE ACCOUNTS ARE USED FOR EACH GRANT TO MONITOR RECEIPTS AND DISBURSEMENTS. THE COLLEGE FOLLOWS APPROPRIATE ACCOUNTING AND INTERNAL CONTROL PROCEDURES. ALL REQUIRED FINANCIAL REPORTING TO THE GRANT PROVIDER ARE COMPLETED TIMELY AND AUDITS BY AN INDEPENDENT CPA FIRM ARE DONE WHEN REQUIRED. THE COLLEGE ANNUALLY FILES AN A-133. DISTRIBUTIONS TO STUDENTS ARE MADE ACCORDING TO GRANT REQUIREMENTS.
Scholarships
FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IS AWARDED TO STUDENTS ON THE BASIS OF NEED AND/OR MERIT AS DETERMINED BY SEMINARY ADMISSIONS AND FINANCIAL AID PERSONNEL

IT IS THE POLICY OF GRACE BIBLE COLLEGE TO PROCESS ALL INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AWARDS THROUGH THE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE WHICH CONSISTS OF THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR, VICE PRESIDENT FOR BUSINESS AND FINANCE, AND VICE PRESIDENT FOR COMMUNITY LIFE AND STUDENT SERVICE. THE COMMITTEE MAY ALSO CHOOSE TO OCCASIONALLY INCLUDE OTHER PERTINENT FACULTY OR STAFF.
Financial aid awards are disbursed to students based on the general criteria for institutional financial aid. GPA and enrollment are monitored to ensure criteria is met.

Most University of Saint Francis students receive financial aid. The Office of Financial Aid at the University of Saint Francis administers financial aid from federal, state, institutional and private resources according to the Federal guidelines provided by the U.S. Department of Education. The University of Saint Francis bases financial aid awards on the information submitted by the student and family via the FAFSA, as well as the student's academic records.
The Organization awards grants to students to be used for educational purposes by debiting the students account directly. This system ensures that the funds are used appropriately.

ICAHN SCHOOL OF MEDICINE AT MOUNT SINAI AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AS EITHER NEED-BASED OR MERIT-BASED AWARDS. TO AWARD OR ADMINISTER NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS, THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID FOLLOWS FEDERAL GUIDELINES STARTING WITH THE EVALUATION OF EACH STUDENT FOR "NEED" BASED ON FAFSA & NEED-ACCESS REPORTS. MERIT-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BY COMMITTEES ESTABLISHED BY THE DEAN OF THE SCHOOL. ONCE AWARDEES ARE CHOSEN, THE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED THROUGH THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID. ELIGIBILITY FOR EACH ACADEMIC YEAR (SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS AND CURRENT ENROLLMENT) IS VERIFIED BY THE DIRECTOR PRIOR TO INITIAL DISBURSEMENT OF ANNUAL SCHOLARSHIPS AND ELIGIBILITY IS VERIFIED AGAIN FOR THE JANUARY TERM BEFORE SECOND TERM DISBURSEMENTS ARE MADE.
THE UNIVERSITY FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS GRANTS BASED ON DOE TITLE IV REGULATIONS AND UNIVERSITY APPROVED POLICIES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: THE COLLEGE HAS A VERY EXTENSIVE APPLICATION FOR FINANCIAL AID WHICH IS CONSISTENTLY MONITORED AND SUBJECTED TO EXTERNAL AUDITS.
Current student financial aid records are verified and compared with eligibility requirements before grants are awarded.

MONIES GIVEN TO THESE ORGANIZATIONS ARE FOR THE SUPPORT OF ANOTHER ORGANIZATION THAT THE COLLEGE ADMINISTRATION BELIEVES IS WORTHY OF THEIR SUPPORT. THE USE OF THE FUNDS IS MONITORED IN THAT THE COLLEGE KNOWS THAT THE SPECIFIC INDIVIDUALS WHO WORK FOR THOSE ORGANIZATIONS ARE ON THE COLLEGE'S CAMPUS MINISTERING TO STUDENTS. REGARDING SCHOLARSHIPS, THESE ARE VERY SELDOM PAID IN CASH. THE SCHOLARSHIPS (WITH THE EXCEPTION OF A FEW SMALL HONORS DAY AWARDS) ARE PLACED DIRECTLY ON THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNTS AND THE SCHOLARSHIPS NEVER EXCEED THE TOTAL COSTS CHARGED.
THE ORGANIZATION ONLY GAVE NON-CASH TUITION REDUCTION SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS. THE ORGANIZATION HAS SET CRITERIA FOR SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: STUDENTS ARE AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON AN EVALUATION OF NEED AND ELIGIBILITY FOR SPECIFIC AWARDS IN ACCORDANCE WITH ANY DONOR STIPULATIONS. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR MAKING SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS AND FOR MONITORING ONGOING ELIGIBILITY (E.G. MAINTENANCE OF SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS).

THE COLLEGE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAINTAINS RECORDS TO SUBSTANTIATE THE AMOUNTS OF TUITION ASSISTANCE INCLUDING ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA. THIS OFFICE ENSURES THAT FUNDS ARE PROPERLY CREDITED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AND MONITORS STUDENTS' CONTINUING ELIGIBILITY TO RECEIVE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE.

The Financial Aid office maintains a database of all students, their eligibility for grant funds determined through FASFA and other analytic procedures, the amount awarded and accepted by each student and documentation of verifying data. The College also has an A-133 audit performed each year in addition to the financial statement audit.

Grants or assistance provided is for scholarships and grants to Simpson College students which are applied directly to the student's tuition charges. The Office of Financial Assistance awards scholarships and grants to students based on a variety of different criteria for each scholarship.

Grant funds are monitored through an electronic packaging program for all students. This electronic program determines the eligibility for federal, state and institutional grant funding against a series of pre-established eligibility criteria. Once the program determines each student's eligibility for federal, state and institutional grant funding. The information is also checked by a member of the Student Financial Planning staff.

BOTH THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND BUSINESS OFFICE RECONCILE ALL SCHOLARSHIPS EACH SEMESTER TO VERIFY THAT THEY INDEED ARE CORRECT ON THE STUDENTS ACCOUNT AND IN THE G/L SYSTEM.

Financial Aid funds are awarded and monitored by the Financial Aid Department. Research awards are monitored by the Office of Sponsored Research Administration.

EARTH University Foundation was formed to support the educational mission of the Escuela de Agricultura de La Region Tropical Humeda through generous gifts from the global community and other programs and initiatives. The Foundation is a registered 501(c)(3) public charity headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia. EARTH University is an international institution created out of a deep conviction that the environmental and social challenges confronting the planet can be resolved through education that promotes science, technology and entrepreneurship while focusing on essential human values, leadership and a commitment to social and environmental service. The University provides support to the Earth University Foundation to cover administrative expenses. The Foundation intends that most of the money it raises be directed to the University to support its educational mission. The University requires periodic reports from the Foundation on the expenses it incurs and the manner in which it is using monies provided by the University. Since the Foundation's primary exempt purpose is to support the University's mission, there is no concern that monies sent to the Foundation will be used other than for a purpose that furthers the University's mission.

THE DEAN'S OFFICE MONITORS THE GRADES FOR ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING GRANTS. STUDENTS WITH CUMULATIVE GRADE POINT AVERAGES BELOW THE REQUIREMENT FOR THEIR DEGREE PROGRAM RISK LOSING THEIR GRANTS. ALSO, THE DEAN'S OFFICE MONITORS THE NUMBER OF CLASSES TAKEN BY ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING GRANTS. GRANTS ARE ONLY AVAILABLE FOR THE REQUIRED NUMBER OF COURSES FOR THE STUDENT'S DEGREE PROGRAM. NO GRANT IS AVAILABLE FOR ANY STUDENT THAT EXCEEDS THE REQUIRED NUMBER OF COURSES. AN AUDIT IS PERFORMED ANNUALLY BY THE SEMINARY'S INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.
ALL FUNDS DISTRIBUTED TO STUDENTS ARE DONE SO IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE ORGANIZATION'S ESTABLISHED FINANCIAL AID POLICIES.

THE ORGANIZATION USES A SOFTWARE CALLED ED EXPRESS TO MONITOR THE ELIGIBILITY OF THE FUNDS GRANTED TO THE STUDENTS FOR WORK STUDY, SCHOLARSHIPS & TUITION DISCOUNTS. THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION. THE ORGANIZATION ALSO UNDERGOES AN ANNUAL FINANCIAL AID AUDIT.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS: USE OF GRANT FUNDING MUST COMPLY WITH THE INSTITUTION'S PURCHASING POLICY AND FEDERAL GUIDELINES. PRIMARY INVESTIGATORS ARE ULTIMATELY RESPONSIBLE FOR THE USE OF THOSE FUNDS UDNER THE REVIEW OF THE CONTRACT AND GRANTS ACCOUNTING MANAGER THAT MONITORS THEIR COMPLIANCE. IN ADDITION, THE COLLEGE IS SUBJECT TO AN A133 ANNUAL AUDIT ENSURING AN OUTSIDE OPINION ON THE INSTITUTION'S POLICIES AND PROCEDURES.

ALL FUNDS ARE AWARDED THROUGH THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND POSTED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS BY THE STUDENT ACCOUNTS OFFICE. STUDENTS MAY BE AWARDED GRANT FUNDS ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND/OR FINANCIAL NEED. IN EACH CASE THE STUDENT CAN RETAIN ELIGIBILITY FOR FUNDING FOR AS MANY AS EIGHT SEMESTERS AS A FULL-TIME STUDENT, PROVIDED THE STUDENT MEETS THE RENEWAL CRITERIA SUCH AS GRADE POINT AVERAGE AND GRADE PROCESSION AS OUTLINED IN THE STUDENT HANDBOOK. AN INDIVIDUAL STUDENT MAY NOT RECEIVE MORE THAN THE COST OF TUITION FROM THE INSTITUTIONAL GRANT FUNDS. A RECONCILIATION IS DONE REGULARLY BETWEEN THE TWO DEPARTMENTS/SYSTEMS TO ENSURE ACCURACY AND PROPER USE OF THE FUNDS. IN ADDITION, AN ANNUAL AUDIT IS PERFORMED BY AN OUTSIDE ACCOUNTING FIRM TO REVIEW COMPLIANCE WITH ALL FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL POLICIES AND PROCEDURES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Description Of Procedure For Monitoring Use Of Grant Funds
ExplntnTxt: ALL GRANT APPLICATIONS ARE KEPT IN STORAGE FOR SEVEN YEARS. PREVIOUSLY UNFUNDED APPLICANTS FOR GRANT MONIES FROM BEREA COLLEGE APPALACHIAN FUND (BCAF) FOLLOW CRITERIA AND A FORMAT WHICH ARE CLEARLY STATED ON THE PROGRAM WEBSITE: HTTP://WWW.BEREA.EDU/APPALACHIANFUND/APPLYINGFORGRANT.ASP. PREVIOUSLY FUNDED APPLICANTS MUST PROVIDE A DETAILED REPORT ON THE USE OF THE PREVIOUS YEAR'S GRANT FUNDING. THIS FORMAT AND CRITERIA ARE LOCATED ON THE SAME LOCATION OF THE BCAF WEBSITE. IN ADDITION, THE BCAF SPONSORS A GRANTEE CONFERENCE EACH SPRING WHEN ALL GRANTEES FOR THAT YEAR MEET AND CONDUCT PUBLIC PRESENTATIONS OF THEIR GRANT FUNDED WORK. THE BCAF IS IN REGULAR CONTACT WITH GRANTEES THROUGHOUT THE YEAR, VISITING EACH NEW GRANTEE AND REPEAT GRANTEES WHERE POSSIBLE. The staff of Grow Appalachia, including the director and two assistant directors, all individually review funding proposals from the potential partner sites for quality of programming, outreach activities and budget line items. This staff then meet as a group and discuss each proposal and either approve them as submitted, reject them out of hand, accept them conditionally asking for clarification or request more information to allow a sound decision. When the information requests are met the staff meet again and either accept or reject the proposal. Grow Appalachia also has an advisory board consisting of college and non-college members who are kept informed of Grow Appalachia's activities and program direction and who then offer advice and counsel for the program. FEDERAL, STATE, INSTITUTIONAL AND OTHER GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON FINANCIAL INFORMATION GAINED FROM THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) THAT IS COMPLETED EACH YEAR. A THIRD-PARTY SOFTWARE VENDOR PROVIDES THE FEDERAL REGULATIONS BY WHICH GRANTS ARE GIVEN. THE FAFSA INFORMATION COMES FROM ELECTRONIC FILES WHICH ARE PASSWORD PROTECTED.ALL STUDENT APPLICATIONS FOR GRANTS ARE STORED ELECTRONICALLY AND ARE PASSWORD PROTECTED. DISBURSEMENTS ARE REVIEWED DAILY TO INSURE ACCURACY.

PRE-AWARD SUBRECIPIENT MONITOR: Federal awards are identified by informing each subrecipient of CFDA title and number, award name and number, award year, and name of Federal agency. If any of this information is not available, the pass-through entity shall provide the best information available to describe the Federal award. The subrecipient is advised of requirements imposed by governing laws, regulations, and provisions of contracts or grant agreements and supplemental requirements imposed by the pass-through entity. The subrecipient's activities are monitored to ensure that awards are used for authorized purposes in compliance with laws, regulations, and the provisions of contracts or grant agreements and that performance goals are achieved. Assurance is ascertained that any subrecipient expending $500,000 or more in Federal awards during the subrecipient's fiscal year must meet the audit requirements of OMB A-133. A management decision on audit findings must be issued within six months after receipt of the subrecipient's audit report and ensure that the subrecipient takes appropriate and timely corrective action. A determination is made as to whether subrecipient audit results necessitate adjustment of the pass-through entity's own records. Each subrecipient is required to permit the pass-through entity and auditors to have access to the records and financial statements as necessary for the pass-through entity to comply with this part. POST-AWARD SUBRECIPIENT MONITORING: The Principal Investigator (PI) or Program Director (PD) is responsible for monitoring the activities. The subrecipient should submit progress reports, technical reports and other deliverables to the PI/PD by specified due dates. The PI/PD is responsible for forwarding copies of the subrecipient's report(s) to the Office of Research and Sponsored Programs (ORSP). Subrecipient invoices submitted to the university must contain the following information: invoice must be on subcontractor's letterhead, date of invoice, invoice number, period of performance covered by the invoice, itemized description of services and backup documentation, current period costs, including cost sharing, cumulative project costs, including cost sharing and subrecipient contact person with respect to the invoice. Invoice must be signed by an authorized official of the subcontractor. Invoice must contain a certification that all payments requested are for appropriate purposes and in accordance with the agreements set forth in the application and award documents. The PI/PD is responsible for reviewing and approving invoices from subrecipient(s) for adherence to the budget. The signature of the PI/PD on the invoice indicates that the review has taken place and that the invoice adheres to budget. Grant Accounting will review the subrecipient's invoice(s) for the following: period of performance is within the contract period, appropriate invoice format and level of detail, signatures of the PI/PD, certification of signature by authorized subrecipient representatives, funds are available in contract, and cost share documentation is provided, if applicable. Grant Accounting is responsible for ensuring that subrecipients that expend $500,000 or more of Federal funds each fiscal year submit an A133 Audit Certification Letter. The following is required to close out a subrecipient award: receipt of final invoice, receipt of cost share documentation, if applicable, time and effort certifications, final progress and technical reports, annual A133 certification letter. Grant Accounting is responsible for tracking payments made to individuals or organizations and where payments are made when out of the US as required by the Schedules F and I - Form 990. EDUCATIONAL ASSISTANCE: Educational assistance is awarded based on financial need and merit. Need based assistance is awarded after review of the student's FAFSA, tax return, transcripts, W-2 statements, and other relevant financial documents. Students are required to maintain satisfactory academic progress in order to continue to be eligible for need based assistance. Students' Grade Point Averages and earned units are reviewed each academic year to ensure satisfactory academic progress is achieved. Merit based educational assistance is awarded to students via Committee. Students who are awarded merit based assistance are required to maintain satisfactory academic progress in accordance with the terms of the assistance received. Need and merit based educational assistance are funded directly to the student's accounts receivable balance to offset tuition, fees, and room and board. Any resulting refunds are issued to the student. Students are granted research awards by their academic departments and work with faculty advisors who monitor the research performed by the student.
Grant funds consist of institutional discounts for employees of APUC and APU.

THE GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED BY CLEARY UNIVERSITY ARE USED TO PAY TUITION AND FEE CHARGES ON STUDENT ACCOUNTS. THE UNIVERSITY IS ABLE TO MONITOR WHETHER RECIPIENTS REMAIN STUDENTS AT THE UNIVERSITY THROUGH THE REGISTRAR'S OFFICE, AND CLASS ATTENDANCE TAKEN BY PROFESSORS.

Students qualify for federal, state, and institutional scholarships, grants, and loans based on their individual FAFSA application. Merit awards are based on levels of achievement academically, musically, or artistically. Entitlement grants are given for students with a family connection to the College, denominational affiliation, and travel grants for students traveling a long distance from campus. International students may be awarded grants and scholarships to come to study. Grants are awarded by the financial aid office following federal, state and institutional guidelines, which are also monitored and applied in the business office. Funds are audited annually by independent auditors.

POLICIES AND PROCEDURES FOR DISBURSEMENTS ARE SET BY THE COLLEGE'S GOVERNING BOARD. INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS ARE ADEQUATELY INVESTIGATED TO INSURE THAT THEY ARE QUALIFYING RECIPIENTS. STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE INSTITUTION'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

The financial aid office at William Jessup University requires students to complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) form to determine eligibility for Federal, State and institutional grants, scholarships, and loans. This is an equitable formula that measures all assets consistently. Enrollment and eligibility are monitored by the University.

PART I, lINE 2 THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS A WIDE VARIETY OF MERIT AND NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS. MERIT AWARDS ARE GIVEN IN RECOGNITION OF VARIOUS ACHIEVEMENTS AS SPECIFIED IN DONORS' CORRESPONDENCE AND DOCUMENTS. NEED-BASED AWARDS ARE PROVIDED BASED ON THE INCOME LEVEL AVAILABILITY OF AWARDS OFFERED ELSEWHERE AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS. THE UNIVERSITY ONLY MAKES SCHOLARSHIP GRANTS THAT HELP OFFSET THE TUITION OF THE STUDENTS. THE GRANTS ARE DIRECTLY CREDITED AGAINST THE APPLICABLE STUDENT ACCOUNT WHICH ASSURES PROPER USE OF THE GRANT. THE AMOUNT OF THE GRANT IS ADJUSTED, AS NECESSARY, BASED ON ANY SUBSEQUENT CHANGES AFFECTING THE STUDENT'S ORIGINAL ELIGIBILITY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Description Of Procedure For Monitoring Use Of Grant Funds
ExplntnTxt: The Director of Development communicates eligible expenses to Accounting , Business Office and others. The expenses are received and reviewed by the Business Office (COO) as well as reviewed by Controller and Vice President of Finance to ensure compliance with grant requirements, coding, and if costs are allowed. A reconciliation of grant expenditures to accounting records is done monthly and a federal financial report of cash draw downs is completed quarterly. Monitoring of budgeted amounts compared to actual costs is done monthly so that allowable funds are identified and fully utilized within the funding period.

CABRINI COLLEGE DOES NOT PROVIDE GRANTS TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS, HOWEVER ON OCCASION DONATIONS ARE MADE TO OTHER CHARITABLE NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. SINCE THESE ARE DONATIONS, THEY ARE NOT MONITORED FOR A SPECIFIC USE. SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS FOR STUDENTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO A STUDENT'S CABRINI COLLEGE ACCOUNT AND APPLIED TO TUITION AND FEES. ALL FINANCIAL AID IS SUBJECT TO REVISION BASED ON AVAILABILITY, CHANGES IN FAMILY CONTRIBUTION AND/OR CREDIT LOAD. ANNUAL RENEWAL OF FINANCIAL AID IS CONTINUOUS IF INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL NEED REMAINS, ALL REQUIRED DOCUMENTS ARE COMPLETED BY THE PUBLISHED DEADLINE AND SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS IS MAINTAINED CONSISTENT WITH THE CABRINI COLLEGE POLICY.

Financial aid awards are granted to students based on the general criteria for institutional financial aid. Financial aid is applied directly to student accounts through the college's academic management system. Applications for benevolence assistance are evaluated by a committee, and awards are made to needy individuals as funds are available. Benevolence assistance is funded by gifts from donors, faculty, and staff.
