ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, QUESTION 2 The College provides scholarships to students matriculating at the College. Certain criteria are established that each student is required to meet to retain their scholarship. The College does not need to monitor the use of scholarship funds as those amounts are directly spent to defray the cost of tuition. There is no opportunity for the funds to be directed to another purpose.
THE UNIVERSITY MAINTAINS ITS CONTRIBUTIONS TO OTHER 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATIONS IN A SEPARATE GENERAL LEDGER ACCOUNT.

ALL GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE THAT ARE PROVIDED BY THOMAS AQUINAS COLLEGE ARE PART OF A NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID PROGRAM THAT ASSISTS STUDENTS WITH THE COST OF TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD. BESIDES GRANTS, THE ONLY OTHER ASSISTANCE OFFERED IS A NEED-BASED EMPLOYMENT PROGRAM. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAINTAINS RECORDS TO SUBSTANTIATE THE AMOUNT OF THE GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE, THE GRANTEE'S ELIGIBILITY FOR THE GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE, AND THE SELECTION CRITERIA USED TO AWARD THE GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE. ALL GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE ARE CAREFULLY MONITORED BY THOMAS AQUINAS COLLEGE. THE AMOUNTS ARE DISBURSED DIRECTLY INTO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT FOR TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD, AND CONSEQUENTLY, THE COLLEGE HAS FULL CONTROL OVER HOW THE GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE ARE USED.

The awarding of Financial Aid starts after a student is accepted into Bluffton University. Those students who need financial support have to file an application for Federal Student Aid. Bluffton University offers University funds, state and federal grants and student loans. Need-based financial aid grants are awarded based on the calculations from FAFSA and the resulting financial need of the students. Academic scholarships are determined at the time of acceptance and based off of high school GPA and board scores.

Robert Morris University Illinois provides a number of grant/scholarship awards to eligible students based on various criteria such as financial need, merit, academic ability, academic major, and location of attendance. This gift assistance is supported by two important sources: the University reserves a portion of its budget for grants/scholarships, and financial support is contributed by faculty, staff, alumni and friends of the University.

Defiance College awards financial aid on the basis of merit and on the basis of demonstrated need determined in conjunction with the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FASFA). Defiance College scholarships are awarded to eligible students in varying amounts up to full tuition the first year and are renewed each year according to established renewal requirements. Defiance College awards are coordinated with federal, state, and other outside financial aid award programs.
WMED REQUIRES DETAIL LISTINGS OF ALL GRANT EXPENDITURES. ADDITIONALLY WMED MAY REQUEST DETAIL SUPPORT TO SUBSTANTIATE GRANT EXPENDITURES.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE UNITED STATES: AFTER STUDENT HAS BEEN ACCEPTED, THEY MUST FILE A FAFSA. THE UNIVERSITY CONSIDERS ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS, OUTSIDE SCHOLARSHIPS, FEDERAL GRANTS AND STATE ELIGIBILITY IN THAT RESPECTIVE ORDER. IF THE STUDENT NEEDS FUTHER ASSISTANCE, THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS FEDERAL LOANS, COLLEGE GRANTS AND EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES. FINANCIAL AID BASED ON NEED IS AWARDED ON FAFSA CALCULATIONS AND THE RESULTING FINANCIAL AID THAT IS TO BE MET. ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON HIGH SCHOOL GPA, CLASS RANK AND STANDARD TEST SCORES. NEED-BASED GRANTS CAN BE ALLOCATED TO RETURNING STUDENTS BASED ON PREVIOUS YEARS AS LONG AS FINANCIAL NEED IS STILL PRESENT. ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS CONTINUE BASED ON THE STUDENT'S CUMULATIVE GPA AT THE END OF THE YEAR.

THE COLLEGE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON STUDENT FINANCIAL NEED AND ABILITY. BOTH ARE BASED ON SET CRITERIA. THE CRITERIA FOR NEED BASED GRANTS IS BASED ON FEDERAL NEED LEVELS SUCH AS PELL ELIGIBILITY. MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON THE STRENGTH OF THE STUDENT'S PORTFOLIO.

Scholarships and grants are distributed to students by posting the funds directly to their student accounts to offset charges for tuition, fees, and room and board. Any remaining credit is refunded to the student via check or direct deposit for use in purchasing books, housing, food, etc. Contributions to exempt organizations that further the University's exempt purpose require approval of a vice president.
THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES INSTITUITIONAL AID TO STUDENTS MAINTAINING ENROLLMENT.
THE COLLEGE'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID AWARDED TO STUDENTS ARE BASED UPON THE GUIDELINES PROVIDED BY THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION.
COLLEGE ADVISING CORPS CONDUCTS MONITORING VISITS WITH THE PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE I, PART II
ExplntnTxt: THE NEGATIVE AMOUNTS REPORTED IN PARTS I AND II ARE DUE TO MULTI-YEAR GRANTS WHICH WERE AWARDED AND RECOGNIZED IN PRIOR YEARS AND EXPIRED IN THE CURRENT YEAR. CAC'S GRANT AGREEMENTS SPECIFY THAT MONIES NOT USED BY THE GRANTEE UPON COMPLETION OF THE GRANT REVERT TO CAC, AND CONSEQUENTLY THE FOLLOWING "NEGATIVE EXPENSES" WERE RECORDED IN THE CURRENT YEAR: DAVIDSON COLLEGE -$133,922 DUKE UNIVERSITY -$48,108 TEXAS CHRISTIAN UNIVERSITY -$142,693 TRINITY UNIVERSITY -$95,945 NORTH CAROLINA STATE UNIVERSITY -$99,709

SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO MEET THE FINANCIAL REQUIREMENTS AS DEMONSTRATED BY THE RESULTS FROM FEDERAL FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID. ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS ALSO MEET THE SPECIFIC CRITERIA AS IDENTIFIED BY THE DONORS. INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID IS ALSO AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO MEET SPECIFIC MERIT OR AFFILIATION CRITERIA. RECIPIENTS OF TUITION REMISSION AND EXCHANGE PROGRAMS ARE VERIFIED FIRST BY THE DIRECTOR OF HUMAN RESOURCES.

INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS AND DISCOUNTS AND ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE ARE RECONCILED BY THE ACCOUNTING DEPARTMENT TO VERIFY THE APPROPRIATE AMOUNT WAS CREDITED TO THE CORRECT STUDENT'S ACCOUNT EVERY SEMESTER.

The financial aid planning office at Anderson University requires students to complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) form to determine eligibility for federal, state and institutional grants, scholarships and loans. This is an equitable formula that measures all assets consistently. In addition to this form, the University does require some other guidelines in the event that funds are offered based upon certain academic credentials or performance in a University sponsored activity or athletic event. These credentials are clearly stated in the University catalog and the University website. Enrollment and eligibility are monitored by the University to ensure students remain eligible for funds awarded.

ALL STUDENT AWARDS ARE MAINTAINED IN THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID SOFTWARE SYSTEM. FEDERAL AWARDS ARE BASED ON FINANCIAL AND OTHER DATA PROVIDED BY THE STUDENT AND VERIFIED, AS APPROPRIATE, BY THE COLLEGE. FEDERAL AWARDS ARE SUBJECT TO AN ANNUAL AUDIT BASED ON STANDARDS FOUND IN OMB CIRCULAR A-133 AND PERFORMED BY AN INDEPENDENT AUDITOR. SELECTION CRITERIA FOR DONOR-FUNDED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MOSTLY DETERMINED BY THE DONOR AND IS AVAILABLE IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. SELECTION CRITERIA FOR FEDERAL AND STATE AID IS ALSO FOUND IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC ON THE INTERNET.

STUDENTS MUST APPLY FOR FINANCIAL AID. THEIR APPLICATIONS ARE REVIEWED BY A COLLEGE COMMITTEE. AWARDS ARE BASED ON A COMBINATION OF NEED AND ACADEMICS. FUNDS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S TUITION AND FEES.
THERE IS ALSO A FOLLOW UP PROCESS DURING THE QUARTER TO ASSURE STUDENT IS MAKING SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS BEFORE ADDITIONAL FINANCIAL AID IS REWARDED.

All scholarships are monitored by the Financial Aid Office with attention given to the criteria set forth for each award as well as the student's enrollment status. The scholarships are applied directly to the student accounts.

MEREDITH COLLEGE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE OFFICE HAS SYSTEMS AND INTERNAL PROCEDURES IN PLACE THAT ENSURES THE PROPER DETERMINATION, DISBURSEMENT AND MONITORING OF GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS. THESE SYSTEMS AND PROCEDURES COMPLY WITH THE FEDERAL STUDENT TITLE IV AID REGULATIONS, NORTH CAROLINA STATE EDUCATION ASSISTANCE AUTHORITY RULES, AND INSTITUTIONAL POLICIES.

STUDENTS AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS MUST BE ENROLLED, AND FOR CONTINUED FUNDING, MUST SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETE THE SEMESTER PROJECT; SOME SCHOLARSHIPS REQUIRES MANUSCRIPT SUBMISSION, REVIEW AND SELECTION BY FACULTY.

ALL GRANTS ARE DISBURSED TO THE STUDENTS ACCOUNTS DIRECTLY, ACCORDING TO GOVERNMENT REGULATIONS. ALL OUTSIDE GRANTS ARE APPLIED TO THE STUDENTS ACCOUNTS AS PER THE INSTRUCTIONS FROM THE GRANTOR. LAKELAND COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT MONITORS ALL GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS USING POWERFAIDS SOFTWARE WHICH IS VERIFIED WITH COD BEFORE DISBURSEMENTS ARE PROCESSED. FOR OUTSIDE AND OTHER INSTITUTIONAL AID, THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT FOLLOWS THE SAME PROCEDURES.

SCHOLARSHIP AMOUNTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AFTER A THOROUGH REVIEW OF ELIGIBILITY AND SELECTION CRITERIA. THE UNIVERSITY HAS AN EXPERIENCED FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT THAT MONITORS THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS.

Scholarships issued to University students are applied to the student's account. A list of scholarship, fellowship and grant assistance awarded is on file at the University. Although there may be recipients who are related to persons having interest in the University, such persons are selected on an equal and objective basis as with other recipients. All students receiving assistance are selected on the University's criteria for academic and financial need, and other similar criteria. The University does not discriminate on the basis of age, gender, ethnic or racial origin, physical or mental disability, marital or veteran status in administration of scholarships or loans. Also, note that the University provides remitted tuition to qualified faculty, staff and certain dependents as a benefit of employment.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grants and Other Assistance in U.S. PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: Scholarships and grants are awarded as financial assistance to students attending the Stevens Institute of Technology. The distribution and application of the financial assistance are based on the specific criteria of each scholarship and grant and are administered consistent with federal, state, and institutional student aid policies. Administration of financial assistance is monitored on an on-going basis through a review of bi-weekly system-generated reports.

THROUGH A COMPETITIVE RFP PROCESS, TCASN SPONSORS SEED GRANTS TO SCHOOL DISTRICTS AND PUBLIC SCHOOLS TO CONDUCT COMPREHENSIVE PROGRAMS TO HELP STUDENTS TO ACCESS AND SUCCEED IN THEIR EDUCATIONAL EFFORTS; MAKES MODEL GRANTS TO SCHOOL DISTRICTS AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS TO PROVIDE CONTINUING SUPPORT FOR PROGRAMS PROVIDING BEST PRACTICES IN COLLEGE ACCESS AND SUCCESS SERVICES; AND AWARDS ONE-TIME CATALYST GRANTS FOR ORGANIZATIONAL AND PROJECT DEVELOPMENT GRANTS TO PROVIDE SCHOOL DISTRICTS, SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS THE OPPORTUNITY TO IMPROVE EXISTING COLLEGE ACCESS SERVICES. AWARD SELECTION IS BASED ON INDEPENDENT PANEL REVIEW OF APPLICATIONS AND PROGRAM MONITORING OF AWARDS OCCURS THROUGH MONTHLY REVIEW OF REIMBURSABLE EXPENDITURES PRIOR TO PAYMENT, SITE VISITS, AND BI-ANNUAL PERFORMANCE REPORTING.

The Foundation does not award grants but provides other assistance in the form of contributions and non-cash contributions to the University and its Education Foundation as support for the University as our 509(a)(3) staus requires.
SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATIONS AND STUDENT TRANSCRIPTS ARE REVIEWED AND KEPT ON FILE TO ENSURE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS ARE MET FOR THE SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED.

A STUDENT MUST COMPLETE A FAFSA APPLICATION FOR THE GIVEN ACADEMIC YEAR. THE STUDENT MUST BE ENROLLED IN A DEGREE SEEKING PROGRAM; NON MATRICULATED STUDENTS ARE NOT ELIGIBLE FOR FINANCIAL AID FUNDS. STUDENTS MUST ENROLL FOR AT LEAST 6 CREDITS TO RECEIVE ANY FEDERAL FUNDS, EXCEPT STUDENTS WHO QUALIFY FOR THE PELL GRANT PROGRAM. UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS MUST MAINTAIN A CUMULATIVE GPA OF 2.0 AND GRADUATE STUDENTS MUST MAINTAIN A CUMULATIVE GPA OF 3.0 EACH SEMESTER.

Part I, Line 2 - Procedures for monitoring the use of grant funds Martin University only awards institutional and privately funded financial aid awards as assistance for students based on a case by case basis, based on merit and need. In doing so, the University's financial aid department adheres strictly to all federal and state regulations and is subject to the compliance and internal control requirements of the OMB Circular A-133.

EMU awards student financial assistance grants and scholarships to eligible students. Use of funds is monitored by the EMU Financial Aid Office and tracked by applying aid to the student account to offset charges to tuition and fees.

ALL STUDENT AID AWARD LETTERS ARE PREPARED BY LINDENWOOD COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. EACH AWARD LETTER HAS A STATEMENT OF CONDITIONS AND IS SIGNED BY THE STUDENT. THE BUSINESS OFFICE POSTS ALL AID TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT FOR ACADEMIC USAGE. BOTH THE BUSINESS OFFICE AND THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITOR THESE FUNDS.
ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE COLLEGE FOR TUITION OF THE ENROLLEE.
THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE DETERMINES STUDENT ELIGIBILITY FOR FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS ACCORDING TO THE UNIVERSITY'S ESTABLISHED ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA AND REGULATIONS.

OTHER ASSISTANCE AS OTHER UNIVERSITY SUPPORT IS PROVIDED TO THE UNIVERSITY BY DISBURSING DONATED FUNDS TO VARIOUS EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES OF THE UNIVERSITY. THESE DISBURSEMENTS REQUIRE DOCUMENTATION STATING THE REASON FOR THE DISBURSEMENT AND ARE APPROVED BY A SUPERVISOR KNOWLEDGABLE ABOUT THE ACTIVITY REQUESTING THE FUNDING.

GRANTS AND CONTRIBUTIONS TO THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTH CAROLINA AND RELATED ENTITIES ARE MADE AFTER COLLABORATION WITH THE UNIVERSITY. MANY CONTRIBUTIONS ARE BASED ON COMMITMENTS MADE COLLEGIALLY BETWEEN THE UNITS. OTHERS ARE RECURRING PROJECTS, EQUIPMENT PURCHASES OR EXPENSE ITEMS. THERE IS NO FORMAL GRANT WRITING IN THIS PROCESS.
ALL GRANTS ARE USED TO PAY TUITION AT THE COLLEGE.
THE UNIVERSITY REVIEWS AND APPLIES CRITERIA BASED ON CIRCUMSTANCE, GRADE-POINT AVERAGE AND NEED. THE PROCESS IS APPLIED CONSISTENTLY TO ALL STUDENTS OF THE INSTITUTION.
THE UNIVERSITY COMPLIES WITH ALL CONTRACTUAL AND FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS WHEN DETERMINING ELIGIBILITY OF SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE INSTITUTION TRACKS THIS INFORMATION BY SOURCE IN ITS ENTERPRISE RESOURCE PLANNING SYSTEM.
ALL GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY THE BUSINESS OFFICE AND FINANCIAL AID OFFICE TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH EACH GRANT. THEY ARE ALSO MONITORED BY MEMBERS OF SENIOR STAFF.

AFTER AN APPLICATION IS SUBMITTED BY THE STUDENT, FINANCIAL AID EVALUATES IT FOR NEED AND BASED ON THEIR ENROLLED COURSES, AND THIS IS RE-EVALUATED EACH YEAR AS NEED AND ENROLLMENT INDICATE. THE UNIVERSITY DOES MONITOR THE USE OF THE STUDENT AID AND IT IS APPLIED TO THEIR STUDENT BILLING ACCOUNT IN THE UNIVERSITY'S SIS (STUDENT INFORMATION SYSTEM).

THE COLLEGE COMPLIES WITH THE U.S. DEP. OF EDUCATION POLICY REGARDING TITLE IV FUNDS AND OTHER GRANT AWARDS. THE COLLEGE HAS DEDICATED INDIVIDUALS PERFORM THE WORK OUTLINED IN THE SCOPE OF THE GRANT. THESE INDIVIDUALS ARE CLASSIFIED AS FINANCIAL AID PROFESSIONALS AND GRANT ADMINISTRATORS WHO WORK IN CONJUNCTION WITH FINANCE PROFESSIONALS TO ENSURE PROPER STEWARDSHIP OF FUNDS. THESE INDIVIDUALS FOLLOW THE STATUTORY AND REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN THE GRANT. FUNDS ARE DRAWN AFTER EXPENSES ARE INCURRED. PROGRESS REPORTS ARE SUBMITTED IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE GRANT REQUIREMENTS AND DOCUMENTATION IS MAINTAINED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: ALL AWARDS TO STUDENTS ARE MAINTAINED IN THE UNIVERSITYS FINANCIAL AID SOFTWARE. DOCUMENTATION REGARDING ELIGIBILITY IS MAINTAINED IN EACH STUDENTS FILE. CRITERIA FOR INSTITUTIONAL AID IS DETERMINED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AND VARIOUS COMMITTEES. ALSO, MANY INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DONOR-FUNDED AND CONTAIN ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA SPECIFIED BY THE DONOR.

THE OFFICES OF ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT AND FINANCIAL AID OVERSEE THE AWARDING OF BOTH NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID AND MERIT-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS. ONCE A STUDENT HAS COMPLETED THE FINANCIAL AID APPLICATION PROCESS AND IS FOUND ELIGIBLE FOR NEED-BASED AND/OR MERIT BASED AID, SHE WILL RECEIVE A FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE DETAILING THE COMBINATION OF SOURCES USED TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. GRANT FUNDS AWARDED TO STUDENTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS. USAGE IS MONITORED BY VIRTUE OF DIRECT ACCOUNT POSTING.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Description Of Procedure For Monitoring Use Of Grant Funds
ExplntnTxt: Grants provided for Student Financial Aid are awarded by the Financial Aid Office based on appropriate guidelines. All awards are posted directly to the students' account and reviewed by the College's Business Office.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Grants provided for Student Financial Aid are awarded by the Financial Aid Office based on appropriate guidelines. All awards are posted directly to the students' account and reviewed by the College's Business Office.

The Student Financial Services Department maintains records to substantiate eligibility and election criteria for students receiving awards and scholarships. Departments maintain records of selection criteria and eligibility for recipients of stipend and other awards. All payments are uploaded to their respective categories. The business office reconciles accounts and prepares departmental and grantor reports.
MENLO COLLEGE REQUIRES FINANCIAL AID APPLICANTS SUBMIT EVIDENCE OF ELIGIBILITY AND MAINTAINS ONGOING RECORDS OF ATTENDANCE AND SCHOLASTIC ACHIEVEMENTS BY ALL RECIPIENTS.

The College follows federal and state guidelines and internal non-discriminatory guidelines for institutional funding. Institutional funding is based on need, academic qualifications and institutional program needs and is monitored by the financial aid office.

MERIT AND ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON PREVIOUS AND CURRENT ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT. OTHER INTERNAL AND ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON CRITERIA SPECIFIC TO THE SCHOLARSHIP. SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED ARE MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID AND THE FINANCE OFFICE OF THE COLLEGE.

The Vice President for Finance collects grant award letters and instructions from the granting agencies or the BCU grant managers. The Vice President for Finance keeps a fiscal file for each grant, including award letters, instructions, annual accounting records, and financial reports submitted to the grantors. Either the Vice President for Finance or the grant manager submits reports to agencies, depending on the grant. The Vice President for Finance creates a budget for each grant in the grants fund, based on award letters and input from the BCU grant managers. If the grant allows, grant managers may request budget transfers within their grant, which the Vice President for Finance or the Assistant Vice President for Finance enter in Datatel. The grant manager signs off on expenditures for the grant. The Vice President for Finance reviews all grant expenditures monthly, with more in-depth review as needed for reporting grantors. The Vice President for Finance reconciles grant expenditures annually, for both BCU fiscal year and the grant fiscal year if different. Financial aid grants are approved and reported by the Financial Aid department. Checks for grant revenues are received n the Business Office; some agencies mail them to the grant managers, who then turn them in to the Business Office for deposit. Some agencies pay BCU through direct deposit into BCU checking accounts. The Vice President for Finance draws down federal grant funds electronically through the online G5 system; drawdowns are usually done monthly.
FUNDS GRANTED ARE IN THE FORM OF FINANCIAL AID SCHOLARSHIPS AND ARE THEREFORE MONITORED AS PART OF THE ONGOING OPERATIONS OF THE ORGANIZATION AS A SCHOOL.

THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT DETERMINES THE ELIGIBILITY OF ALL STUDENTS AT THE COLLEGE AND MAINTAINS APPROPRIATE RECORDS TO SUPPORT ELIGIBILITY. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT PACKAGES AID BASED ON INDIVIDUAL STUDENT'S NEED. ALL STUDENT FINANCIAL AID CREDITED TO THE STUDENTS IS ELECTRONICALLY REPORTED TO THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION.

Moravian College follows state and federal regulation in administering scholarship and grants as well as institutional policy when administering college funds. Moravian follows federal methodology to determine financial need for awarding federal funds and institutional methodology in awarding need-based institutional funds. All students applying for financial aid follow an annual application process completing the free application for federal student aid (FAFSA) and an institutional application. Files are reviewed for conflicting information and to complete required verification of application data. Moravian credits all financial aid awards directly to students' receivable account offsetting charges for tuition and fees. Changes in student enrollment status are reviewed to ensure that students remain eligible for financial aid and awards are adjusted as necessary. Any refunds from student accounts are done in compliance with state and federal regulations.
PAY-IT FORWARD SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON A STUDENT'S STATEMENT OF NEED.

WHEN DETERMINING THE AMOUNT OF FINANCIAL AID A STUDENT WILL RECEIVE, THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE FIRST CALCULATES HOW MUCH THE STUDENTS FAMILY CAN REASONABLY AFFORD. THIS CALCULATION RELIES ON TWO PRIMARY SOURCES OF INFORMATION 1) A FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) AND 2) A FINANCIAL AID PROFILE BOTH OF WHICH ARE COMPLETED BY THE FAMILY. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS A FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE THAT FILLS THE GAP BETWEEN THE CALCULATED AMOUNT THE STUDENTS FAMILY CAN REASONABLY AFFORD AND THE COST OF ATTENDING MACALESTER COLLEGE. SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 THE COLLEGES HIGH WINDS FUND AWARDS SMALL GRANTS TO NEIGHBORHOOD ORGANIZATIONS WORKING TO MAKE OUR NEIGHBORHOOD A VIBRANT PLACE TO LIVE, AND TO LOCAL NEIGHBORHOOD COUNCILS COMMITTED TO AREA LIVABILITY ISSUES. GRANT RECIPIENTS ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT A REPORT DESCRIBING USE OF GRANT FUNDS AT LEAST ANNUALLY OR AT THE CLOSE OF A SPECIFIC PROJECT.

GRANTS ARE PRIMARILY TO STUDENTS FOR SCHOLARSHIPS AND ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY AGAINST THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNT RECEIVABLE BALANCE. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE IS PRIMARILY RESPONSIBLE FOR DETERMINING THE ELIGIBILITY AND AWARDING OF THE AID. THIS IS DONE THROUGH SOFTWARE DESIGNED TO ASSIST IN THE PROCESS.

THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS SEVERAL TYPES OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS. GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS UPON ADMISSION AND CREDITED AGAINST THEIR TUITION EACH QUARTER AS LONG AS GPA REQUIREMENTS ARE MET AND MAINTAINED. GPA IS MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL SERVICES OFFICE AND VERIFIED THROUGH THE STUDENT RECORDS PROGRAM. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BY THE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE UPON ADMISSION BASED ON APPLICATION AND ESSAY SUBMISSION. THE SCHOLARSHIPS MAY BE ONE TIME OR RECUR EACH QUARTER, DEPENDING ON THE TYPE OF SCHOLARSHIP. THE ADMISSIONS DEPARTMENT MONITORS APPLICATIONS AND AWARDS, AND THE FINANCIAL SERVICES OFFICE, IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE REGISTRAR, MONITORS QUARTERLY ELIGIBILITY OF RECURRING SCHOLARSHIPS. OTHER LIMITED ONE-TIME SCHOLARSHIPS MAY BE AWARDED AT THE DISCRETION OF THE UNIVERSITY PRESIDENT. THE CURRENT YEAR DISBURSEMENTS WERE FUNDED BY THE SCHOOL AS LENDER PROGRAM.

OUR FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE UNITED STATES. THEY REVIEW EACH STUDENT TO VERIFY THEIR ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS FOR THE SPECIFIC GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE.

THE SEOG CONTRIBUTION NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS IS BASED ON AN ESTIMATE SINCE THE FIGURES ARE CALCULATED ON THE INSTITUTIONAL SHARE BASED ON TOTAL AMOUNT OF FUNDS AWARDED. FOR EXAMPLE, THE AVERAGE AMOUNT OF SEOG GIVEN TO STUDENTS IS $568 PER YEAR AND THE TOTAL INSTITUTIONAL FUNDS GIVEN IS $57,322. DIVIDING $57,322 BY $568 YIELDS APPROXIMATELY 101 STUDENTS. THE FALL AND SPRING SCHOLARSHIPS NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS IS AN AVERAGE BASED ON THE SEMESTERS. IN THE FALL SEMESTER, THERE WERE___ STUDENT AWARDED AND IN THE SPRING SEMESTER THERE WERE ___ STUDENTS AWARDED FOR AN AVERAGE OF THE TWO SEMESTERS OF __. THE WORK-STUDY NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS IS BASED ON THE TOTAL NUMBER OF STUDENTS THAT RECEIVED FEDERAL WORK-STUDY FUNDS, BUT THE AMOUNT OF CASH GRANT OF $284,650 IS ONLY THE INSTITUTIONAL SHARE OF FEDERAL WORK-STUDY.

Emergency Aid: Students are required to substantiate a legitimate need for benevolence before money is awarded. No attempt to verify the use of the money is made.Tuition assistance: Tuition is discounted to apply aid.
ONCE TROCAIRE COLLEGE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS, DISCOUNTS, AND/OR STUDENT AID, AND THE STUDENT ACCEPTS THOSE FUNDS, THE COLLEGE DIRECTLY CREDITS THE STUDENTS TUITION BILL.

THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT DETERMINES ALL FEDERAL AND STATE FINANCIAL AID FOR STUDENTS BASED ON THE RESPECTIVE LAWS AND REGULATIONS. THE REMAINING NEED FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IS THEN DETERMINED BY THE COLLEGE AND IS BASED ON CRITERIA SUCH AS STUDENT ACTIVITIES (ATHLETICS, ETC.), THE ACADEMIC PROGRAM THE STUDENT IS ENROLLED IN, THE STUDENT'S ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, AND THE INCOME LEVEL OF THE STUDENT. THESE FACTORS ARE THEN CONSIDERED ALONG WITH THE AVAILABLE INSITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIP AND GRANT FUNDS IN DETERMINING INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROVIDED TO THE STUDENTS.

GRANTS GIVEN TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS ARE TO FURTHER EDUCATION, HEALTHCARE AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT IN THE AREAS SURROUNDING THE ORGANIZATION. ALL GRANTS ARE GIVEN TO ORGANIZATIONS WITH BOARDS CONSISTING OF CIVIC, PHILANTHROPIC AND BUSINESS LEADERS WHO MONITOR THE USE OF GRANTS AND ENSURE THEY'RE USED FOR PROPER PURPOSES. SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TOWARDS THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNTS TO OFFSET TUITION COSTS TO ENSURE THAT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE USED ONLY FOR STUDENT EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES.
SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS MUST MEET REQUIREMENTS ESTABLISHED BY A COMMITTEE OF THE COLLEGE.
ORGANIZATION RECEIVES OFFICIAL RECEIPTS FOR THE GRANTS GIVEN

To ensure our grants and scholarships are used for proper purposes the Financial Aid Office performs regular maintenance and reconciliation with our Bursar's Office monitoring that all funds awarded to a particular student are being properly credited to their student account. Any changes or adjustments to original awards that affect grant and scholarship funding are documented, saved and then copied to our Bursar's Office. These processes are completed utilizing an automated software system which allows us to generate reports at anytime for monitoring and reconciliation purposes. Additionally, we have a yearly audit performed by an outside accounting firm guaranteeing we are staying in compliance with all federal, state, and institutional policies and procedures as well as assuring funding is being used as intended.
HAWAII TOKAI INTERNATIONAL COLLEGE GIVES TUITION WAIVERS TO STUDENTS THAT QUALIFY AND ACCOUNT FOR SUCH THROUGH LETTERS TO THE STUDENTS THAT RECEIVE THESE WAIVERS.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS THE INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON MERIT, TALENT, LEADERSHIP ACTIVITIES AND RELATIONSHIPS BASED ON UNIVERSITY HERITAGE AND MISSION. THIS IS PRIMARILY FROM THE APPLICATION FOR ADMISSION, TRANSCRIPTS AND TEST SCORES, BUT MAY ALSO INCLUDE AUDITIONS AND TRY-OUTS. AWARDS WITH SPECIFIC RENEWAL CRITERIA ARE MONITORED EACH SEMESTER BY THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL SERVICES.

STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE DETERMINED BY THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID THROUGH CAREFUL STUDY OF THE INFORMATION ON THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA), THE STUDENT'S ACADEMIC RECORD, TEST SCORES, AND RECOMMENDATIONS. DETAILED RECORDS AND STATISTICS ARE MAINTAINED BY THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID AND THE OFFICE OF ASSESSMENT AND INSTITUTIONAL RESEARCH IN REGARDS TO ALL FINANCIAL AID AWARDED TO STUDENTS OF THE COLLEGE, INCLUDING GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS.

Student financial aid is awarded after an application and eligibility verification process, using the FAFSA for establishing financial need, and GPA and recommendations to establish merit. Competitions and other award qualifications are used to determine eligibility where applicable. Records are maintained in our Financial Aid office; scholarships and awards are applied directly to student accounts.
We follow the requirements of the research agreements.

The financial aid office at Charleston Southern University requires students to complete the Free Application for Federal Student aid (FAFSA) form to determine eligibility for Federal, State and institutional grants, scholarships and loans. This is an equitable formula that measures all assets consistently. In addition to this form, the institution does require some other guidelines in the event that funds are offered based upon certain academic credentials or performance in a University sponsored activity or athletic event. These credentials are clearly stated in the University catalog and the University website. Enrollment and eligibility are monitored by the University.
The College maintains records for all students receiving financial assistance administered by the College. Records include the financial and academic performance records relative to award decisions.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: STUDENT INSTITUTIONAL AID AND ASSISTANCE IS AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON MERIT AND/OR NEED AND IS APPLIED TO INDIVIDUAL STUDENT ACCOUNTS. THE UNIVERSITY'S OFFICE OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID IS RESPONSIBLE FOR REVIEWING EACH STUDENT'S CUMULATIVE GRADE POINT AVERAGE AND OTHER MERIT BASED CRITERIA ALONG WITH A COMPLETED APPLICATION FOR STUDENT FEDERAL AID AND DETERMINES WHETHER A NEED LEVEL IS SUBSTANTIATED BY THE APPLICATION. THE AID AND ASSISTANCE PAYS FOR TUITION, FEES, ROOM AND BOARD, AND BOOKSTORE CHARGES.

GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY VARIOUS AREAS. FINANCIAL AID GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH ELIGIBILITY, SELECTION, AND DISTRIBUTION. DOCUMENTATION IS MAINTAINED AND AUDITED ANNUALLY. OTHER DEPARTMENT GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY THE RESPONSIBLE PARTY TO ENSURE THAT EXPENDITURES COMPLY WITH GRANT REQUIREMENTS AND ARE NOT DIVERTED FOR OTHER USES. THE NC BUDGET OFFICE REQUIRES PERIODIC REPORTING FOR ALL GRANTS. THE REPORTING IS COMPLETED BY THE RESPONSIBLE DEPARTMENT AND THEN ENTERED INTO THE STATE WEBSITE BY THE CONTROLLER ANNUALLY.
THE UNIVERSITY HAS A SPECIFIC DEPARTMENT RELATED TO STUDENT FINANCIAL AID THAT TRACKS ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANT FUNDS DISBURSED TO STUDENTS.

THE COLLEGE COMPLIES WITH THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION POLICY REGARDING TITLE IV FUNDS. THE COLLEGE HAS DEDICATED INDIVIDUALS PERFORM THE WORK OUTLINED IN THE SCOPE OF THE GRANT WHO WORK TO ENSURE PROPER STEWARDSHIP OF FUNDS. THESE INDIVIDUALS FOLLOW THE STATUTORY AND REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN THE GRANT. FUNDS ARE DRAWN AFTER EXPENSES ARE INCURRED. PROGRESS REPORTS ARE SUBMITTED IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE GRANT REQUIREMENTS AND APPROPRIATE DOCUMENTATION IS MAINTAINED.

The College provides scholarships to students matriculating at the College based on need and/or merit. The College monitors students' files to ensure that the student receives necessary financial assistance based on grades, course of study and financial need. All funds granted are required to be used to defray the costs of attendance; funds may not be spent on discretionary items.

THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID MONITORS THE ELIGIBILITY AND AWARDING OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS BY REVIEWING STUDENT NEED BASED ON THE FAFSA REPORT, AWARDING BASED ON PRE-DETERMINED AID CRITERIA, AND MONITORING THE STUDENT STATUS EACH TERM.
ALL STUDENT AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE USED FOR TUITION AND RELATED EXPENSES AT THE COLLEGE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Description Of Procedure For Monitoring Use Of Grant Funds
ExplntnTxt: Scholarships are provided to students based on needs assessments and/or performance. Once the student has been approved to receive the grant, the amount is credited to the student's Baker College account. The College's Financial Aid office monitors the student to make sure the award stays in compliance. If the student does not continue to meet the grant requirements, the student's account may be reduced. Grants and other assistance to organizations in the United States are budgeted each year by the Baker College campus. The campus President determines which organization benefits from a grant based on the community's needs. If the grant exceeds the budget, the Board of Regents must approve the funding. These grants and assistance are awarded to other tax-exempt organizations to be used in any way the recipients see fit to further their mission and tax exempt purpose; the use of these funds is not monitored by the Baker College campus.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE COLLEGE UTILIZES SYSTEMS DESIGNED FOR FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS AND MONITORS THE ACTIVITY AND USES OF FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GRANTS FUNDS WITH THE APPROPRIATE CRITERIA ON AN ONGOING BASIS.

THE COLLEGE DOES NOT GIVE ANY NON-CASH SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED TO STUDENTS THROUGH CREDITING THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS. IF THE STUDENT HAS ANY EXCESS SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS OVER THEIR CHARGES, THESE FUNDS ARE DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK. THE COLLEGE'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S. ARE AS FOLLOWS: THE COLLEGE HAS APPOINTED DIRECTORS, WHO REPORT TO THE APPROPRIATE VICE PRESIDENTS, OVER ALL FEDERAL GRANT PROGRAMS. THESE DIRECTORS ARE CHARGED WITH PERFORMING ALL GRANT-RELATED ACTIVITIES INCLUDING APPLICATION, MONITORING OF EXPENDITURES AND REPORTING, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF DRAW-DOWNS OF FEDERAL FUNDS. DRAW-DOWNS ARE PERFORMED BY THE COLLEGE'S CONTROLLER AFTER REQUESTS ARE MADE BY THE DIRECTOR TO THE CONTROLLER. THE CONTROLLER REVIEWS THE REQUESTS FOR DRAW-DOWNS, WHICH INCLUDE DOCUMENTATION OF ALL DIRECT AND INDIRECT PROGRAM EXPENSES, BEFORE MAKING THE DRAW-DOWNS. A SINGLE AUDIT IS PERFORMED ANNUALLY BY THE COLLEGE'S INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Description Of Procedure For Monitoring Use Of Grant Funds
ExplntnTxt: Grant funds are monitored through an institutional administrative database in accordance with federal, state, local and institutional regulations and policies.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Grant funds are monitored through an institutional administrative database in accordance with federal, state, local and institutional regulations and policies.

The College determines the eligibility for each student's needs, the awards are credited to the student's account and the Office of Financial Aid monitors the student's continued eligibility to receive the assistance.

Master's College and Seminary awards financial aid grants to students in accordance with the College's institutional financial aid policies. All scholarships are awarded to current students of the institution, thus enabling the institution to track their academic performance and use of all scholarship funds.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED ARE FOR USE TO REDUCE TUITION AND FEES AT WINEBRENNER AND CANNOT BE RECEIVED AS CASH OR USED ELSEWHERE.

ACADEMIC AWARDS ARE MONITORED AT THE TIME OF ADMISSION. ALL STUDENTS ARE REVIEWED FOR ACADEMIC AWARD ELIGIBILITY. THE SAME CRITERIA IS USED FOR ALL STUDENTS, INTERNATIONAL OR NOT. IF STUDENTS ARE ELIGIBLE THEY ARE NOTIFIED ALONG WITH THEIR OFFER OF ADMISSION. RENEWAL IS BASED, AMONG OTHER THINGS, ON CUMULATIVE GPA, RESIDENTIAL STATUS, ETC. FRANCISCAN INSTITUTE (FI) AWARDS ARE REVIEWED FOR ELIGIBILITY AND AMOUNTS ARE DETERMINED BY FI. ATHLETIC AWARDS ARE IN ADDITION TO ACADEMIC AWARDS AND ARE DETERMINED BASED ON THE SPORT, NCAA STANDARDS, INTERNAL FUNDS AVAILABILITY, AND NEGOTIATIONS BETWEEN THE COACH AND ATHLETE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: BAPTIST MISSIONARY ASSOCIATION THEOLOGICAL SEMINARY UTILIZES A SPECIALIZED SOFTWARE PROGRAM TO TRACK THE USE OF FINANCIAL AID FUNDS. A PROSPECTIVE RECIPIENT APPLIES ONLINE THROUGH A GOVERNMENT WEB SITE WHO THEN SENDS THE INFORMATION TO THE SEMINARY. INFORMATION ON THE APPLICATION IS VERIFIED INTERNALLY AND, BASED ON GUIDELINES IN THE FEDERAL STUDENT FINANCIAL AID HANDBOOK, IT IS DETERMINED THE AMOUNT OF AID THE RECIPIENT QUALIFIES FOR. UPON RECEIPT OF THE FUNDS, PROCEDURES ARE IN PLACE TO ENSURE THAT THE FUNDS ARE CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE RECIPIENTS ACCOUNT.

SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS ARE SELECTED BASED ON ESTABLISHED MERIT AND NEED BASED CRITERIA. THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR AND ACADEMIC DEPARTMENT HEADS WORK TOGETHER TO SELECT RECIPIENTS OF IN-HOUSE SCHOLARSHIPS. QUALIFICATIONS FOR SCHOLARSHIPS VARY. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AND ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS.

GENEVA COLLEGE AWARDS GRANTS BASED UPON THE FOLLOWING: THE COLLEGE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS BASED ON MERIT AND FINANCIAL NEED. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND BUSINESS OFFICE MAINTAIN RECORDS ON WHAT STUDENTS ARE AWARDED, AND THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE HAS SPECIFIC CRITERIA THAT MUST BE FOLLOWED IN AWARDING AID TO STUDENTS. THE CRITERIA FOR AWARDING AID IS DOCUMENTED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE INSTITUTION'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENTS, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED UPON MERIT OR FINANCIAL NEED. STUDENTS APPLY FOR INDIVIDUAL SCHOLARSHIPS THROUGH THE OFFICE OF INSTITUTIONAL ADVANCEMENT AND ARE AWARDED BASED UPON THE CRITERIA FOR EACH INDIVIDUAL SCHOLARSHIP - THEY ARE AWARDED BY A COMMITTEE. ATHLETIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED DURING THE RECRUITMENT PROCESS AND ARE AWARDED BASED UPON MERIT. FRESHMEN ENROLLMENT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE OFFERED TO INCOMING FRESHMEN BASED UPON THEIR INDIVIDUAL HIGH SCHOOL PERFORMANCE, SAT SCORES AND FINANCIAL NEEDS. THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS MATRICULATING AT THE COLLEGE; THEREFORE, ALL FUNDS GRANTED ARE USED TO DEFRAY THE COST OF TUITION AND NO FURTHER MONITORING OF THE GRANTS IS REQUIRED.

WESTMINSTER COLLEGE FINANCIAL AID AWARDING PROCESS FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED TO INCOMING FIRST YEAR STUDENTS ON THE BASIS OF THE RESULTS OF THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) AND BY THE USE OF A FINANCIAL AID MATRIX. THE FINANCIAL AID MATRIX IS BASED ON ACADEMIC ABILITY AND FINANCIAL NEED. WITHIN EACH CELL OF THE MATRIX THERE IS A FLOOR AND A CEILING RANGE USED FOR THE AWARDING OF INSTITUTIONAL FUNDS. A STUDENT IS PLACED INTO A FINANCIAL AID MATRIX CELL BASED ON BOTH HIGH SCHOOL GRADE POINT AVERAGE AND SAT AND/OR ACT SCORES. THE AMOUNT A STUDENT IS AWARDED BETWEEN THE FLOOR AND CEILING VALUE IN THE CELL IS BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED AS DETERMINED BY THE FAFSA. INSTITUTIONAL MERIT AWARDS (AWARDED BY ADMISSIONS) THESE ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS REGARDLESS OF FINANCIAL NEED. MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS (UNFUNDED AID) ACCEPTED FIRST YEAR STUDENTS ARE AWARDED A MERIT SCHOLARSHIP DETERMINED BY WHERE THEY FALL IN THE MATRIX BASED ON HIGH SCHOOL GRADE POINT AVERAGE AND SAT AND/OR ACT SCORES. THE MERIT SCHOLARSHIP AWARD IS THE FLOOR VALUE FROM THE RESPECTIVE MATRIX CELL. STUDENTS WHO FALL IN THE TOP 20% OF THE APPLICANT POOL MAY BE SELECTED BY THE ADMISSIONS STAFF AS A WESTMINSTER SCHOLAR. SELECTED STUDENTS ARE GUARANTEED A MERIT AWARD WHICH IS THE FLOOR VALUE FROM THE MATRIX CELL. THE WESTMINSTER SCHOLAR IS ALSO GIVEN AN OPPORTUNITY TO COMPETE FOR A LARGER FOUR YEAR AWARD THROUGH THE SCHOLARS COMPETITIONS HELD ON THE WESTMINSTER CAMPUS. THIS COMPETITION HAS FACULTY INVOLVEMENT AND STUDENT ESSAYS. THE LARGER AWARDS INCLUDE FULL TUITION PRESIDENTIAL SCHOLARSHIPS, VANCE SCHOLARSHIPS, LEMMON SCHOLARSHIPS AND TITAN SCHOLARSHIPS (WITH A RANGE OF VALUES). NOMINATED MERIT BASED SCHOLARSHIPS (UNFUNDED AID) THE NOMINATED SCHOLARSHIPS AVAILABLE TO INCOMING FIRST YEAR STUDENTS ARE: 1) THE YOUNG PRESBYTERIAN SCHOLARSHIP -TO BE ELIGIBLE A STUDENT MUST BE A MEMBER OF THE PRESBYTERIAN CHURCH USA, BE NOMINATED BY HIS/HER CHURCH AND PRESENT A MINIMUM GPA OF 3.5. 2) JERB MILLER SCHOLARSHIP -TO BE ELIGIBLE A STUDENT MUST BE NOMINATED BY AN EDUCATOR WHO IS A WESTMINSTER COLLEGE GRADUATE AND PRESENT A MINIMUM GPA OF 3.5. 3) LEGACY SCHOLARSHIP (FUNDED AID) -TO BE ELIGIBLE A STUDENT MUST PRESENT A CUMULATIVE GPA OF 3.0 AND HAVE A PARENT OR GRANDPARENT WHO EARNED A DEGREE FROM WESTMINSTER COLLEGE. MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE RENEWABLE FOR UP TO THREE YEARS. THE STUDENT NEEDS TO MAINTAIN THE REQUIRED SCHOLARSHIP GPA (IF ONE EXISTS), OTHERWISE REMAIN IN GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING. INSTITUTIONAL NEED BASED AWARDS (UNFUNDED AID) NEED BASED INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON THE RESULTS OF THE FAFSA AND THE DETERMINATION OF THE STUDENTS DEMONSTRATED NEED. A STUDENT IS REQUIRED TO FILE A FAFSA FORM IN ORDER TO BE CONSIDERED FOR NEED BASED FINANCIAL AID. THE RESULTS OF THE FAFSA DETERMINE THE STUDENT'S EXPECTED FAMILY CONTRIBUTION (EFC). THE CALCULATION USED TO DETERMINE THE STUDENT'S FINANCIAL NEED IS: DIRECT COST OF ATTENDANCE* - EFC = STUDENT'S NEED (*DIRECT COST OF ATTENDANCE: TUITION & FEES, ROOM & BOARD FOR RESIDENT AND OFF CAMPUS STUDENTS, TUITION & FEES ONLY FOR COMMUTERS) THE CALCULATED STUDENT NEED IS REDUCED BY: FEDERAL NEED BASED FINANCIAL AID STATE NEED BASED FINANCIAL AID FUNDED GIFT AID INSTITUTIONAL MERIT THE REMAINING UNMET NEED, AFTER THE REDUCTIONS, IS MET BY USING INSTITUTIONAL NEED BASED GIFT AID WITH THE TOTAL OF INSTITUTIONAL AID BEING CAPPED BY THE CEILING VALUE FROM THE MATRIX CELL FOR THE STUDENT. INSTITUTIONAL NEED BASED AWARDS ARE USUALLY RENEWED PROVIDED THAT THE STUDENT CONTINUES TO DEMONSTRATE FINANCIAL NEED. FINANCIAL AID PACKAGING STUDENTS RECEIVE A FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE ANNUALLY WHICH INCLUDES ALL SOURCES OF FINANCIAL AID THAT THEY ARE ELIGIBLE AND QUALIFY FOR. AWARDS THAT MAY BE INCLUDED IN A FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE ARE: FEDERAL GRANTS (PELL AND SEOG) STATE GRANTS INSTITUTIONAL MERIT AWARDS INSTITUTIONAL NEED BASED AWARDS INSTITUTIONAL ENDOWED AWARDS FEDERAL LOANS (STAFFORD AND PERKINS) FEDERAL WORK STUDY THE COLLEGE CONTROLLER DETERMINES THE AMOUNT AVAILABLE IN ALL INSTITUTIONAL FUNDS ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. WESTMINSTER COLLEGE UNFUNDED AND FUNDED AID IS PORTABLE FOR OFF-CAMPUS STUDIES IF THE PROGRAM IS REQUIRED BY THE STUDENT'S MAJOR. THESE FUNDS ARE PORTABLE UP TO THE LESS OF 1) THE TUITION OF THE OFF CAMPUS STUDIES PROGRAM, OR 2) THE LIMIT OF A STUDENT'S WESTMINSTER COLLEGE AWARDED AID WHERE A PARTICULAR STUDY-ABROAD PROGRAM'S TUITION IS GREATER THAN THE WESTMINSTER COLLEGE AID THE STUDENT IS ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE FOR THE SAME PERIOD OF ENROLLMENT. BEFORE THESE FUNDS WILL BE PAID TO THE STUDY ABROAD PROGRAM ON THE STUDENT'S BEHALF, THE STUDENT IS REQUIRED TO PROVIDE A COPY OF THE INVOICE FOR THE STUDY ABROAD PROGRAM, WITH A SEPARATE LINE ITEM FOR TUITION. STUDENTS ARE REQUIRED TO HAVE THE INSTITUTION PROVIDE A COPY OF THE ACADEMIC TRANSCRIPTS FOR THE TERM(S) ABROAD TO WESTMINSTER COLLEGE. WESTMINSTER COLLEGES FINANCIAL AID OFFICE USES THE FINANCIAL AID MANAGEMENT SYSTEM POWERFAIDS TO MAINTAIN FINANCIAL AID AWARD RECORDS AND AMOUNTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Procedure for Monitoring Use of Grant Funds Inside U.S.
ExplntnTxt: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 FEDERAL GRANT FUNDS ARE AWARDED IN COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL REGULATIONS APPLICABLE TO THE SPECIFIC PROGRAM. INSTITUTIONAL PROCEDURES ALLOW FOR SEPARATION OF AWARDING AND DISBURSING OF FUNDS. STUDENTS WHO RECEIVE SCHOLARSHIPS AND FEDERAL WORK STUDY FUNDS ARE MONITORED EACH SEMESTER FOR ACADEMIC PROGRESS. ANNUAL AUDITS ARE CONDUCTED BY AN EXTERNAL AUDIT FIRM TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH ALL PROGRAM GUIDELINES.

Monitoring Use of Grants ASSISTANCE to Mercer University students in the form of scholarships are awardeD for the purpose of aiding with the cost of attending the university, i.e. for tuition, housing, and meals. Scholarships are based on academic achievement, need, and other donor requirements such as location of residence. Mercer University has criteria for the eligibility requirements needed to award a scholarship. Academic Scholarships are based on SAT scores and Grade Point Averages and are awarded by the Office of Admissions. Need based grants are made by the Office of Financial Planning and are made utilizing the federal need formula (FAFSA application). Students must be enrolled full-time to receive University scholarships/grants. Generally speaking, FAFSA data is verified for students who are selected for verification by the federal student aid program.
CITY UNIVERSITY OF SEATTLE PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIP GRANTS TO STUDENTS IN THE FORM OF TUITION REDUCTION. MONITORING IS DONE INTERNALLY TO ENSURE THE ACCOUNTS ARE CREDITED PROPERLY.

The Business office reviews the recipient's Form 990 and A-133 audit report if available. The Director of the program at VLS works closely with the recipient of the funds that will be paid by the grant to coordinate activities/training essential for program effectiveness. The recipient submits invoices to VLS which are reviewed and approved by the Program Director to substantiate the grant related purpose. The invoice is then forwarded to the business office for review and coding to the proper accounts. The funds are then forwarded to the recipient. If deemed necessary, VLS may carry out an on site monitoring visit for general training, reviewing of the recipient's procedures/records and informing the recipient of grant requirements.
Scholarships are determined by FAFSA requirements, and need base.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE UNITED STATES: THE ORGANIZATION USES STUDENT FINANCIAL AID GUIDELINES TO MONITOR THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS. WITTENBERG UNIVERSITY ONLY AWARDS INSTITUTIONAL AND PRIVATELY FUNDED FINANCIAL AID AWARD AS ASSISTANCE FOR STUDENTS BASED ON A CASE-BY-CASE BASIS, BASED ON MERIT, NEED, AND EXTRACURRICULAR ACTIVITIES. IN DOING SO, THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT ADHERES STRICTLY TO ALL FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATIONS AND IS SUBJECT TO THE COMPLIANCE AND INTERNAL CONTROL REQUIREMENTS OF OMB-A133, IN WHICH THEY FOLLOW ALL APPLICABLE GUIDELINES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Procedure For Monitoring Use Of Grant Funds Inside U.S.
ExplntnTxt: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Contributions made to other charitable organizations are made pursuant to University policy. Contributions by the University are made where they further the University's mission or its role as a good community citizen. All grants, including sub-grants, are accounted for separately by the University's financial accounting system and each is managed by a principal investigator. Financial activity reports are provided to principal investigators on a daily basis, with reconciliation of financial reports required on a monthly basis. Sub-grants are further monitored by obtaining a grantee's A-133 audits and evaluating the grantee's ability to comply with the terms of the sub-grant. All grant monitoring is subject to the policies and procedures of the University, which are designed to meet federal requirements. The University's Office of Institutional Compliance, Office of Research Services, Restricted Accounting and others are charged with ensuring that all DePaul employees are aware of their responsibilities in developing and maintaining a compliance-conscious environment. Additionally, the Office of Institutional Compliance, Office of Research Services, Restricted Accounting, Principal Investigators and others are charged with ensuring that the University's policies and procedures, as well as local, state and federal laws are followed. This is accomplished through conducting risk assessments, monitoring operational activities, providing online, classroom and/or one-on-one training and other tools that foster compliance. Grants and assistance to students represents financial assistance in the form of institutional scholarships. All scholarships are administered through the University's financial aid system. Institutional scholarships are credited to the student's internal tuition account and represent an offset to tuition and other fees assessed by the University. Grants and assistance to University staff and their eligible spouse, dependents, or an unrelated second domiciled adult represent staff tuition waivers, pursuant to a written benefits plan. Staff tuition waivers are administered through the University's benefits system and, like institutional scholarships for students, are credited to the individual's internal tuition account to offset tuition charges. Taxability of tuition waivers is determined pursuant to sections 127 and 117(d) of the Internal Revenue Code.
THE UNIVERSITY FOLLOWS ALL GOVERNMENT GUIDELINES FOR AWARDING SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MADE FOR ACADEMIC MERIT AND FINANCIAL NEED.

The College maintains complete records for the grants and scholarships provided to all individuals. Those records indicate the criteria used to award the grants, documentation supporting the grantee's eligibility of the award, and substantiation of the amounts awarded. Documentation is also maintained as to when and how the funds are utilized. Where appropriate, periodic reports are prepared, summarizing the allocation of funds and a reconciliation of the amounts spent for each grant and scholarship. The College employs individuals whose primary responsibilities are to oversee the process of distributing financial grants and scholarships. The number of scholarship and grant recipients for cost of attendance are tracked by the administrative system. The number of faculty and student recipients of research awards are estimated based on the type of grants awarded and the number of participants.

VIRTUALLY ALL UNIVERSITY FUNDED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE TIED TO THE STUDENTS' GRADE POINT AVERAGE (GPA) OR BASED UPON FINANCIAL NEED AS DETERMINED BY THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). ANNUALLY, THE GPA AND NEED ARE REVIEWED TO DETERMINE COMPLIANCE WITH THE UNIVERSITY STANDARD. IF A STUDENT'S GPA FALLS BELOW THE MINIMUM REQUIREMENT, THE SCHOLARSHIP IS EITHER REMOVED OR REDUCED BY HALF. STUDENTS CAN APPEAL TO HAVE THE SCHOLARSHIP RESTORED IF THEIR GPA RETURNS TO THE REQUIRED LEVEL. NEED BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CARRIED FORWARD EACH YEAR ONCE THE STUDENT HAS COMPLETED THE FAFSA. THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO CERTAIN LOCAL GOVERNMENTAL AND NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS THAT PROVIDE CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURAL SUPPORT TO THE UNIVERSITY. THE ASSISTANCE IS CONSIDERED A DONATION AND THE UNIVERSITY DOES NO FURTHER MONITORING OF THE USE OF THE FUNDS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS - PART I, LINE 2:
ExplntnTxt: THE MAJORITY OF GRANTS GIVEN TO STUDENTS IN THE UNITED STATES PRIMARILY CONSIST OF NEED-BASED GRANTS. STUDENTS MUST APPLY FOR THESE FINANCIAL AID AWARDS BY COMPLETING TWO FORMS THAT ESTABLISH ELIGIBILITY FOR NEED-BASED AID. THESE ARE STANDARD FORMS USED IN HIGHER EDUCATION FOR THIS PURPOSE: COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIP SERVICE FINANCIAL AID PROFILE AND FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID. SCHOLARSHIPS AND SIMILAR AMOUNTS GIVEN TO STUDENTS AS FINANCIAL AID ARE APPLIED BY THE COLLEGE DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT TO ENSURE THAT THE GRANTS ARE USED FOR THEIR INTENDED PURPOSE. HAMPSHIRE COLLEGE GRANT AID ASSISTANCE IS GENERALLY LIMITED TO THE AMOUNT OF TUITION. THE COLLEGE ALSO OFFERS FINANCIAL AID IN THE FORM OF MERIT-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS. THESE ARE SIMILARLY APPLIED BY THE COLLEGE DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT TO ENSURE THAT THE GRANTS ARE USED FOR THEIR INTENDED PURPOSE AND DO NOT EXCEED THE AMOUNT OF TUITION.

MONITORING GRANT FUNDS: GRANT FUNDS AWARDED TO STUDENTS ARE USED FOR TUITION AND ALLOWABLE EDUCATIONAL EXPENSES. AWARDS ARE BASED ON NEED DETERMINED FROM A FEDERAL FAFSA APPLICATION. GRANT FUNDS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY AGAINST THE TUITION AND FEES OF THE AWARDEE AND DO NOT LEAVE POSSESSION OF THE COLLEGE, THEREFORE NO MONITORING IS NECESSARY.

THE PROCEDURES FOR NEED-BASED AWARDS INCLUDE REVIEW AND RESOLUTION OF ALL FEDERAL-PROCESSOR-IDENTIFIED ELIGIBILITY CONFLICTS, AND 100% VERIFICATION OF REPORTED PARENT AND STUDENT INCOMES. FOR ALL FUNDS, THERE IS A SEPARATION OF THE AWARDING AND DISBURSEMENT FUNCTIONS (DIFFERENT INDIVIDUALS RESPONSIBLE FOR EACH), MONTHLY RECONCILIATIONS BETWEEN STUDENT ACCOUNTS AND THE COLLEGE'S GENERAL LEDGER, AND AN ANNUAL AUDIT IN ACCORDANCE WITH OMB CIRCULAR A-133.
THE CASH GRANT IS REFLECTED ON STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS.

Grants and other assistance to organizations in the United States are budgeted each year by the Baker College Campus. The Campus President determines which organization benefits from a grant based on the community's needs. If the grant exceeds the budget, the Board of Regents must approve the funding. These grants and assistance are awarded to other tax-exempt organizations to be used in any way the recipients see fit to further their mission and tax exempt purpose; the use of these funds is not monitored by the Baker College campus.

THE UNIVERSITY'S OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES AWARDS ALL FEDERAL AND STATE FINANCIAL AID GRANTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATIONS. DONOR RESTRICTED GRANTS ARE AWARDED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE DONOR'S WISHES.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE GIVEN TO INDIVIDUALS BASED ON NEED AND MERIT TO AID WITH TUITION AND FEES. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE A REDUCTION OF TUITION AND FEES AND PROVIDED DIRECTLY BY THE UNIVERSITY. RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED FOR ELIGIBILITY AND THE SELECTION CRITERIA.
D.R.E.A.M. PARTNERSHIP MAINTAINS ALL NECESSARY GRANT DOCUMENTATION. ALSO, GRANTS ARE APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: WISCONSIN SCHOOL OF PROFESSIONAL PSYCHOLOGY OFFERS A MINORITY SCHOLARSHIP TO QUALIFIED INCOMING MINORITY STUDENTS. ELIGIBILITY FOR THE SCHOLARSHIP IS BASED UPON MINORITY STATUS, PROVEN ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE, AS WELL AS FINANCIAL NEED

THE UNIVERSITY OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIP AND GRANTS TO STUDENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH UNIVERSITY POLICIES AND DONOR GUIDELINES. THE UNIVERSITY ALSO MAINTAINS COMPREHENSIVE RECORD OF THE SAME.

A LIST OF RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS IS ON FILE AT THE INSTITUTION AND IS AVAILABLE ON REQUEST. ALTHOUGH THERE MAY BE RECIPIENTS WHO ARE RELATED TO PERSONS HAVING AN INTEREST IN THE INSTITUTION, SUCH RECIPIENTS ARE SELECTED ON AN EQUAL, OBJECTIVELY DETERMINABLE BASIS WITH OTHER RECIPIENTS. THAT IS, ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE INSTITUTION'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC AND MUSIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

THE COLLEGE AWARDS GRANTS ON A FISCAL YEAR BASED ACCORDING TO THE OVERALL YEARLY BUDGET. INDIVIDUAL AWARDS ARE PACKAGED BASED ON AN OVERALL COLLEGE STRATEGY EMPLOYING NEED AND MERIT CRITERIA. THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE WORKS WITH OUTSIDE CONSULTANTS TO PREPARE PACKAGES. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE WORKS WITH STUDENTS TO ACCEPT AND/OR ADJUST INDIVIDUAL GRANTS. THE COLLEGE ALSO PROVIDES CHARITABLE SUPPORT TO U.S. SECTION 501(C)(3) PUBLIC CHARITIES IN FURTHERANCE OF ITS MISSION.
CASH GRANTS ARE CREDITS TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS.
The College provides scholarships under an application process.

DISBURSEMENTS TO STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL AID ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH INSTITUTIONAL PROCEDURES TO ENSURE THAT THOSE RECEIVING AID ARE QUALIFYING RECIPIENTS. FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID AND/OR ASSISTANCE FROM GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES IS DISTRIBUTED AND MONITORED IN ACCORDANCE WITH FEDERALLY APPROVED NEED ANALYSIS CRITERIA OR OTHER AGENCY PROVIDED CRITERIA.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: The College's procedures for monitoring the use of grant funds requires verification of 1) enrollment status, 2) number of hours enrolled, 3) number of earned credit hours, 4) GPA, and 5) housing status. In addition, a review of student academic performance and grades of incomplete, if applcable, is conducted each semester to determine overall standing in relation to College's established Satisfactory Academic Policy (SAP).

THE UNIVERSITY'S STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS (GRANTS) ARE NON-CASH TUITION DISCOUNTS APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AND CANNOT BE DIVERTED FROM INTENDED USES. THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS REPORTED ABOVE WAS COMPILED FROM SCHOLARSHIP DISBURSEMENT RECORDS FOR THE REPORTED FISCAL YEAR. THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS ALL RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS TO DETERMINE BOTH INITIAL AND CONTINUING ELIGIBILITY BASED UPON THE CRITERIA FOR EACH TYPE OF AWARD. VARIOUS CRITERIA MAY INCLUDE, BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO, ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, FINANCIAL NEED, OR OTHER CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY THE FUNDING SOURCE.
MCPHS UNIVERSITY TRANSFERRED AN UNRESTRICTED CAPITAL CONTRIBUTION IN THE AMOUNT OF $300,000 TO THE NEW ENGLAND SCHOOL OF ACUPUNCTURE, INC., A CONTROLLED TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION (SEE SCHEDULE R).

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 - MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS
ExplntnTxt: ALL GRADUATE STUDENTS ADMITTED TO THE SEMINARY RECEIVE A FULL TUITION SCHOLARSHIP. STUDENTS ADMITTED TO THE KOLLEL LEARNING PROGRAMS MAY ALSO RECEIVE A STIPEND AND/OR HOUSING BENEFIT. SITE VISITS AND FOLLOW-UP DISCUSSIONS WITH THE MANAGEMENT OF GRANTEES ARE CONDUCTED TO ASSURE THAT GRANT FUNDS ARE USED FOR THE INTENDED TAX-EXEMPT EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Description Of Procedure For Monitoring Use Of Grant Funds
ExplntnTxt: Grant funds and scholarships are credited directly to the students' accounts to ensure the appropriate use of funds.

ExplntnTxt: Grant funds and scholarships are credited directly to the students' accounts to ensure the appropriate use of funds.
THE SCHOOL APPLIES THE MONIES GRANTED TO STUDENTS FOR TUITION DIRECTLY TO TUITION COSTS.

ExplntnTxt: Scholarships are provided to students based on needs assessments and/or performance. Once the student has been approved to receive the grant, the amount is credited to the student's Baker College account. The Campus Financial Aid office monitors the student to make sure the award stays in compliance. If the student does not continue to meet the grant requirements, the student's account may be reduced. These grants and assistance are awarded to other tax-exempt organizations to be used in any way the recipients see fit to further their mission and tax exempt purpose; the use of these funds is not monitored by the Baker College campus.

Once the student has been approved to receive the grant, the amount is credited to the student's Baker College account. The Campus Financial Aid office monitors the student to make sure the award stays in compliance. If the student does not continue to meet the grant requirements, the student's account may be reduced.
